news uk-news moment-woman-swept-out-sea-"Cornwall: Woman rescued from sea after coastguard spotted pink hatByAlahna KindredNews Reporter:,  Nov | commentsThis is the incredible moment a woman was airlted from the sea by the coastguard. The swimmer had been swept out to sea at Little Fistral beach in Cornwall and was spotted thanks to her bright pink swim cap. She was holding a pink float which also helped her to be easily spotted by someone on shore who called  on Saturday at .pm. Newquay and Padstow coastguard rescue teams were deployed along with both Newquay RNLI leboats and the coastguard helicopter from Newquay. The dramatic rescue was caught on camera by the coastguard. In the clip, the woman can be seen being pulled out of the water by a team member before they help her into the helicopter.  Matt Rogers, Team Leader with HM Coastguard said: This swimmer had done a considerable amount to give herself a chance of being rescuedthings went wrong. She not only had a float that was a bright pink colour but was wearing a hat of the same colour too. It meant our caller could help give us information that enabled the swimmer to be rescued quickly. Itaposs a reminder of how quickly things can go wrong even for the most experienced and why you should do all you can to help us help youthe worst happens.  Newquay RNLI later posted: Newquayaposs RNLI leboat volunteers were paged for an immediate launch at .pm on Saturdayafter a  call was received, reporting a swimmer in dficulties at Little Fistral. The RNLI crew responded from the harbour and launched the charityaposs D class inshore leboat from Towan Beach in bright conditions and a moderate south-westerly breeze.  The leboat crew were quickly on scene at Little Fistral, where the woman was rescued from the sea by the crew of the Coastguard search and rescue helicopter and checked over by the Coastguard winch paramedic, before being landed safely on the beach. Colleagues from Newquay and Padstow Coastguard Rescue Teams were also alerted and the Maritime and Coastguard Agency have since praised the woman for giving herself the best chance of rescue by using a highly visible pink tow float and wearing a bright cap, which meant the  caller was able to provide accurate information on her position as emergency crews responded.According to the RNLI,you find yourself in trouble in the water, you can help yourself get back to safety by learning to float. Floating minimises your risk of gasping uncontrollably and breathing in water, which can quickly lead to downing. Here’s how to do it.  Fight your instinct to thrash around First, keep calm and try not to panic. Your instinct will be to swim hard – don’t.  Lean back Lean back, extending your arms and legs, to keep your mouth and nose out of the water and your airway clear.  Gentle movements If you need to, gently move your arms and legs in a sculling motion to help you float.  Catch your breath Float until you can control your breathing. Do this for - seconds or until you feel calm.  Now think about how to get out Only now can you think about the next steps. If you can, swim to safety. If someone is nearby, raise a hand and call for help. Remember,you find yourself in trouble in the water – Float to Live. Read more here. The RNLI volunteers ed at .pm and recovered the leboat onto Towan Beach shortly after low tide . Please be aware, as of last weekend there are no longer RNLI leguards on duty at our local beaches, until spring next year. In an emergency at the coast, call  and ask for the Coastguard andyouaposre calling for someone , stay on scene until you are met by emergency services. news uk-news morgue-monster-david-fullers-horried-"David Fuller is arrested for historic murders of two womenByPatrick HillDan WarburtonReporter for the Sunday Mirror and People:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov | comments A horried nurse has told of her two-year affair with morgue monster David Fuller, not knowing he had killed two women.The warped hospital electrician wooed the unsuspecting woman with cocktails and concert tickets. Then he dumped her for another nurse – all behind the back of his trusting we. Fuller, , would go on to abuse scores of bodies in two hospital mortuaries. But his mistress only learned of his grotesque offences when he faced court last week. She told the Sunday Mirror today: “To think I’m associated with someone who did something so terrible is awful. I’m very lucky he didn’t kill me.”  As MPs called for an inquiry into Fuller’s hospital access, the woman, whose identity we are protecting, also revealed:She lived in a studio flat just around the corner from his two victims in the Bedsit Murders. Fuller charmed her and seemed the “perfect gentleman”. They met at a hospital social club, he drank Archers and lemonade and once took her to a Beverley Craven pop concert. Fuller always appeared to be ice cool and “would never get angry”.The woman believed Fuller to be an “ordinary, quiet man” – yet he was an arrogant lothario who had affairs with at least two female colleagues during three marriages. She started dating Fuller in  when he was with second we. Three years earlier he had sexually assaulted and killed Wendy Knell, , and Caroline Pierce, , in Tunbridge Wells, Kent.  The woman, now happily married, said: “I was quite aware of the Bedsit Murders and I was very nervous about them. The murders were in my mind and a lot of young women’s minds. “Little did I know I was actually dating the person responsible. In the back of my mind I do still think, ‘Why was I spared ’ “I was in the right criteria in that I lived in the roads near where the girls worked, I had a bedsit and I was in my s.”  Fuller admitted his guilt last week, four days into a murder trial. It was then revealed in court that he had defiled up to  bodies in hospital morgues. His female victims ranged in age from nine to . The revelations have shaken Fuller’s ex to the core. She told the Sunday Mirror: “He was a perfect gentleman with me. I didn’t see a bad side to him at all.  “There was nothing to lead me to believe he’s the person we’ve now found him out to be now. “He never showed any perversion in bed. He was totally ordinary and normal. There was nothing at all. I still can’t believe that he could be capable and part of me still doesn’t want to believe it, but equally I want him to pay for what he’s done. “I didn’t know anything about the mortuary offences until it came out in court. I was really shocked. The police said to me, ‘Be prepared for a nasty shock’, but I wasn’t expecting anything as horric as this. I just thought it was going to be that there were other women like me, or multiple women that he was dating all at the same time. It’s been a traumatic time.”  She went on: “I was  when I began seeing him and I was with him for just over two years. “I was a district nurse and some of us used to go up to the canteen in Kent and Sussex Hospital . I was at a loose end and trying to make new friends, so I started going to the social club. I remember thinking he was quite odd for a man because he drank Archers and lemonade. “He wasn’t a beer man. He was quite a quiet man, but he was quite friendly. He just seemed like a perfectly ordinary person.”  She remembers Fuller being in a cycling club and doing the -mile London to Brighton ride. One of the club routes went directly past the dyke where he dumped murdered Caroline. Of their dates, she said: “The first outing was to the Folkestone Air Show. We once went to a Beverley Craven concert in London and he would visit me at my flat, but most of it was at the social club at the hospital. “He wasn’t the type of bloke to take me out for dinner or offer to take me anywhere particularly, but he was always pleasant and friendly. He would never get angry. It was hard to know what was going on in his head.  “He was an electrician at Kent  Sussex Hospital at the time. Sometimes when he was on call, rather than stay in his house at Broomhill Bank School, he’d stay in the nurses’ home. “I knew he was unhappy with his we. But our relationship ended because he didn’t want what I wanted and he didn’t want to be with me any more. I had to accept that he didn’t want me and he wanted someone . “I remember him saying to me that he had met another staff nurse and he was going to start seeing her.”  The woman called police last December after news of Fuller’s arrest. She explained: “When I saw his name I thought, ‘Well, Fuller is a common surname’. I looked at my phone hours later and there was a photo of him. I recognised him from the fact his eye was turning in. I was really shocked.” Fuller’s arrest came after a DNA breakthrough. A search of his home uncovered hard drives revealing prolic sexual offending of a kind no British court has seen before. Between  and , he had filmed and photographed himself sexually abusing the bodies of dozens of women and girls at the Kent and Sussex Hospital and nearby Tunbridge Wells Hospital. Fuller admitted two counts of murder at Maidstone Crown Court. He previously admitted  sexual offences, including  counts relating to  identiable mortuary victims. MPs have called for a public inquiry. And the daughter of one victim said: “It kills me to think of David Fuller’s hands on Mum in the mortuary.” Meanwhile, his shaken ex is having counselling. She added: “What he did is up there with the Moors Murderers, the Wests and Shipman. If I could eradicate it all, I would. I keep thinking, ‘Why was I so naive and stupid to get involved with someone like him ’” aposFailure to learn lessons of Savileapos - Comment, by Mark Williams-Thomas, the ex-cop who exposed Jimmy Savile The dead deserve as much dignity as the living, but David Fuller denied victims any respect whatsoever. He got away with murder for  years. Evading capture, he convinced himself he was untouchable. And, like all sex offenders, he then sought out vulnerable victims – dead women and children – to fulfil his warped sexual desires. But it is only by luck and the arrogance of Fuller that the police uncovered sexual offending as far back as  at two Kent hospitals because he kept “trophies” of his attacks and records of his abuse. In , I exposed Jimmy Savile – the DJ and TV star who sexually assaulted patients for decades across the NHS. It led to  hospitals undertaking urgent reviews.But it is clear now that lessons were not learned and, yet again, the most vulnerable in our society have been failed. In  Fuller had a criminal records check which revealed he had hidden a string of burglary convictions. Yet he stayed in post. Fuller should have been sacked immediately. So why wasn’t he  Crimes of necrophilia are extremely rare and carry a maximum jail term of just two years. Post-Savile, a review highlighted the need to reduce access to mortuaries, yet this was clearly not the case at two Kent hospitals.  When Fuller murdered Wendy and Caroline he took trophies – something he repeated will all his future victims. That brings with it considerable risk because it’s a forensic link to the victim and compelling evidence. So why take such a risk  I have no doubt Fuller kept trophies so he could relive his attacks and watch footage again, enabling him to get perverse sexual gratication. I’ve no doubt Fuller has abused many more women and young people. His offending will be far wider than hospital mortuaries. I would go much further, given that we have over , unsolved murders in the UK and everything that I know about Fuller and how offenders operate. I say with some confidence that he killed again after . title: one bed bungalow close birmingham
story: One-bed bungalow close to Birmingham on sale for the price of a second-hand carAuctioneer Bond Wolfe has put the bungalow up for sale with the guide price of just £,. The one-bed home shows lots of potential for those who are new to the property marketThere is a hall, store, reception room, kitchen, one bedroom and a shower roomByAndy Richardson:,  Nov The ideal home for first-time buyers is up for sale in Birmingham and it could be yours for the price of a second hand car. Auctioneer Bond Wolfe has registered the property in Kings Norton - near sought after areas like Selly Oak and upmarket Harborne - with a guide price of just £,.The one-bed property shows lots of potential for those who are new to the property market, BirminghamLive reports. There is a hall, store, reception room, kitchen, one bedroom and a shower room. The property stands back from the road and has both a front and spacious rear garden with a shed.  There is a central heating system in the property and UPVC double glazing. People have the chance to view the property before the auction. It is freehold. The property is set to be live-streamed on the day with remote bidding by proxy, telephone or on the internet.  Potential bidders are being asked to pre-register to bid no later than  noon on December .The auction is set to take place on December .Most ReadDont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterMORE ON First-time buyers" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: queen novel way eating bananas
story: Queen has novel way of eating bananas so she doesnt look like a gobbling monkeyAccording to a former royal chef, the Queen refuses to peel a banana like the rest of us and has a more unusual technique for eating the fruit Image: Getty ImagesByJenner NewtonRoyal Features Writer:,  Nov | commentsEating a banana while trying to look elegant can prove to be quite dficult - but not for the Queen. Thataposs because according to a former royal chef she has an unusual technique for eating the fruit so she doesnapost look like a gobbling monkey. Unlike the rest of us, Her Majesty refuses to peel and then eat it, instead, she peels it with a kne and fork. According to Darren McGrady, who once worked in the royal kitchens, the Queen would cut the top and bottom off, then slice the skin away -ways. She then chopped it up into small pieces before eating them with a fork.  Being strict about the way she eats bananas isnapost the Queenaposs only food quirk. She will never eat or serve, garlic - even on formal occasions. Although she has good reasons behind this - itaposs because the royal family have to meet and greet so many people so never wants the smell of garlic on her breath. Shellfish is also a no go area as itaposs one of the foods most likely to cause food poisoning. However, it was recently reported the Queen has given up one of her nightly habits when it comes to food and drink.  Love the royals for the Mirroraposs daily newsletter to get all the latest news on the Queen, Charles, Kate, Wills, Meghan, Harry and the rest of The Firm. Click here to sign up. Sheaposs now believed to be foregoing her nightly cocktail on the advice of doctors so she is as healthy as possible. It was said that the Queen, , enjoyed a martini most evenings although she is rarely seen drinking in public and isnapost a big drinker. But it is now thought Her Majesty is shunning alcohol altogether - except for at special occasions. Her decision to give up booze is not linked to any health issues and a palace source said: It is a recent and personal decision by the Queen. Meanwhile, a family friend told Vanity Fairaposs royal correspondent Katie Nicholl: The Queen has been told to give up her evening drink which is usually a martini. It’s not really a big deal for her, she is not a big drinker but it seems a trle unfair that at this stage in her le she’s having to give up one of very few pleasures.” Comment MORE ON The QueenRoyal Family" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get our daily royal round-up direct to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. news uk-news queens-speech-shows-greater-closeness-"Queen praises work of Charles and William in COP speechByWilliam WalkerNews Reporter:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov | commentsThe Queenaposs speech at the COP climate summit showed a greater closeness between Prince William and Prince Charles, a royal expert has claimed. The monarch delivered a video message to world leaders and governments at a reception at the climate change summit in Glasgow. In her speech she said there is always room for hope despite huge challenges of the climate emergency. She called on world leaders to recognise “that the time for words has now moved to the time for action”. There was also a touching tribute to her late husband Prince Philip and she spoke of her great pride of her son Charles and grandson William taking on the baton to campaign for the planet. Valentine Low, royal correspondent for The Times, said in a piece on Saturday that the speech sheds light on the current dynamics working within the Royal Family.He said: The passage in which she said how proud she was of the work done by the Prince of Wales and Duke of Cambridge may not have received the attention that it deserved.  Her remarks may also reflect a greater closeness between the three of them. A royal insider also told the publication that the three leading royals are all in alignment on the problems The Firm has faced in recent years. In her speech last week she told how she had been inspired by young people and their enthusiasm to campaign on the issue. She said she had drawn great comfort and inspiration from the relentless enthusiasm of people of all ages – especially the young – in calling for everyone to play their part.She also used her address to pay tribute to her late husband Prince Philip and his decades-long efforts on raising the profile of climate change, quoting from a speech he gave in .Comment MORE ON The QueenPrince WilliamPrince Charles, Prince of WalesRoyal Family" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get our daily royal round-up direct to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: salt bae hiring toilet attendant
story: Salt Bae is hiring a toilet attendant - but itll take them  weeks to afford signature steakThe wages offered at the venue are only £-an-hour which would take any worker three weeks to buy just one of Nusr-Ets £ gold encrusted steaksSalt Baes customers tend to come from wealthy backgrounds Image: Nusr-Et InstagramByGraeme Murray:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov | commentsExclusive steak restaurant Salt Bae is looking to hire a toilet attendant - but many have pointed out that it would take three weeks for the chosen employee to afford their signature steak. The wages offered at the venue are ony £-an-hour which would take any worker three weeks to buy just one of Nusr-Etaposs £ gold encrusted steaks. Duties for wannabe employees, the restaurant says, include dealing with ious bodily fluids and, on occasion, dealing directly with the public. The role only pays between £. and £. per-hour plus tips from customers who will hopefully be generous. One of Salt Baeaposs customeraposs racked up a £,. bill which also included an additional % service charge of £,..  And that doesnapost include gts from customers, with another table tipping Salt Bae himself a £ box of cigars. In the online job advertisement, the restaurant says the successful candidate must be health and safety conscious, as well as honest, trustworthy and punctual. But the would-be worker is unlikely to spot the boss because he is reportedly leaving London to set up a new restaurant in Saudi Arabia. Nusr-Et will not be there to show off his tableside skills for adoring fans such as Wayne and Coleen Rooney, according to reports.Diners have previously shelled-out £ for prime reservations at the Knightsbridge eatery which The Sun claimed has been accused of treating staff badly. Among the items featured on the menu are a £, gold -gilded tomahawk steak while a slightly cheaper £ will get you a hunk of beef or a burger will set you back £. The restaurant, meanwhile, charges £ for a single glass of coke. The job advert reads: Successful applicants for this position will be responsible for the safety, security, cleanliness and proper use of our toilets in the restaurant. Duties include cleaning and servicing the bathroom, ensuring the facilities are secure and safe and keeping up social-distancing measures.  The description states the successful candidate must be health and safety conscious, as well as honest, trustworthy and punctual. Though only in London for a short time, Salt Bae has hit the headlines with many wealthy guests having been keen to attend the restaurant . Since the restaurant opened on September , people with money have turned up to have the Salt Bae treatment. One diner took to social media to show the £, bill for dinner at the exclusive steakhouse . He said the bill included a Golden Tomahawk steak at £,  Nusret Baklavaaposs - a traditional Turkish dessert typically served with Matei Radulescu, a Turkish ice cream, at a total of £, one sautéed broccoli , a portion of asparagus , three herb crusted friesand one side of mashed potato . The Mirror also told how a vintage  bottle of Petrus was £, alone, while two bottles of  Petrus were also consumed at a whopping £, - each. news uk-news savvy-couple-turn-british-gas-"Campervans: UK’s ‘Coolest Campers’ discuss van conversionByDouglas Patient:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov | commentsA savvy couple has renovated a British Gas van into a quirky home for £,. Laura Evans, and Ed Knight, both , set themselves a challenge of making a Caddy Maxi van into a liveable space. The couple from Kingston-upon-Thames, London, deliberately purchased a small van to show others that home on wheels doesn’t always have to be big. The ‘adventure van’ was once used for workers of an energy and home services provider but now it is kitted out with a kitchen and bed. The couple used repurposed materials such as wood and even made a skyline roof by inserting a square window. Laura, who is a shop assistant, said: “It took four months for us to rip everything out, insulate and convert it into a mini camper. “We wanted to challenge ourselves and be creative as the pandemic put a halt on our international travel plans. “The van was in excess of £,. “And it cost £, on the mechanical work and materials such as reclaimed wood for the , the bed frame and small cupboards.“We tried to cut costs as much as we can by purchasing stuff from Facebook marketplace such as Moroccan tiles for the kitchen.“But we bought the oven brand new to ensure it worked.” All appliances such as the oven with a hob, fridge with freezer, tap with an electric pump, LED lighting, l fresh water and full solar system including a leisure battery were brand new.  But the stone sink was purchased from Facebook marketplace but was too big. Laura adds: The solution was to apossinkapos our basin into the unit and let the countertop form around. We love this finish and we believe it looks better thanwe had just simply placed it on top. Just like the kitchen doors, we used Scottish Elm for our countertops but kept the live edges and Eddy cleverly used a jigsaw to cut a waney edge to follow the curvy doors at the end of each unit.  Eddy made solid Elm shaker doors in the kitchen with close weave Rattan  which is a natural cane woven material. It is a biodegradable material which looks amazing. From the outside, the blue vehicle looks like any other Volkswagen van but inside it is a shabby chic space. With a wooden ceiling and laminate flooring, the van boasts enough room for two people but one cannot stand due to the low ceiling.  Ed said: “This is an adventure van - used for sleeping and eating. Itaposs perfect for curling up in bed and watching a movie but it is built as an adventure van so not one for spending days inside. “We loved seeing people’s reaction when we have opened the door in a public place. “They always had to double-take - especiallythey see us with a meal as you would never think there is a working kitchen in it.  “We wanted to show others that you don’t need a massive van to make a home. “We still have our home comforts such as fluffy pillows and a comfy mattress but you can’t stand up.” Ed, who is a joiner, insulated the van and did most of the handy work whilst Laura focused on bargain hunting and interior. The couple spent eight hours per day over eight weeks transforming the van into a living space.  They went on to travel around Cornwall and Isle of Skye, Scotland, before selling it. Ed said: “Laura did the finishing touches too such as most of the painting, oiling and sanding. It is much better to buy an ex-service van because it has been looking after and the mileage is good. “With clever designs, you can do it cheaper - making it better in the long run. “Laura lost her job in events as a result of the pandemic in December . “She began working part-time so this gave her something more to focus on. “We spent a total of £, and made some profit when selling it on. title: top doctor urges pregnant women
story: Top doctor urges pregnant women to get their Covid vaccines as soon as you canProfessor Adam Finn, a member of the Joint Committee on Vaccination and Immunisation said unvaccinated pregnant women should not "defer the vaccination until after the pregnancy"Professor Adam Finn is calling on pregnant women to get the jab Image: Getty Images iStockphotoByWilliam WalkerNews Reporter:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov | commentsA top doctor has urged pregnant women to get the Covid jab as soon as you can to protect themselves and their baby.Professor Adam Finn, a member of the Joint Committee on Vaccination and Immunisation said unjabbed pregnant women should not defer the vaccination until after the pregnancy has ended but to get vaccinated while they are pregnant.He said that pregnant women were at very substantially higher risk of getting seriously ill compared to women of the same age who were not pregnant. The professor warned that it increased the risk of premature delivery as well as risk to the child. His call came as the family of a woman who died last week before getting the chance to hold her new-born daughter made their own plea for people to get the jab. Prof Finn told the BBC : So pregnant women wherever you are in your pregnancy, come forward, get vaccinated and protect yourself and your baby as soon as you can.There are no described risks and very large numbers of pregnant women have now received these vaccines without any report of lost pregnancies or damage or injury to the foetus. So far no evidence at all of any risks of the vaccine, but lots of evidence of real risk of the infection. Saiqa Parveen, , from Birmingham, was taken to hospital in September after contracting Covid-, the broadcaster reported, and her daughter was delivered by emergency caesarean section when she was eight months pregnant.  She died on November  before getting a chance to hold her new-born child. Her brother, Qayoum Mughal, said: I pray to everybody, please, get the vaccine. Save yourselves and your loved ones. The Royal College of Obstetricians and Gynaecologists , previously said it was vital pregnant women received both vaccines as well as the third dose booster vaccinethey are eligible for it. Chief scientic adviser for the Department of Health and Social Care, Professor Lucy Chappell, told BBC News: Of women, over % unvaccinated with Covid- in hospital. Never too late in pregnancy to get vaccinated or have conversation with midwe or GP or obstetrician and we can reduce number of people in hospital and intensive care. Overwhelming data on safety on vaccines is very positive. title: woman 40 followed strange man
story: Woman, , followed by strange man while on walk in early hours saved by her dogLorraine had taken her dog for a run at am when the man started to walk towards her slowly but thankfully her four-legged friend was on hand to scare him offLorraine Scotts German shepherd, TobyByAnnie Williams:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov | commentsA woman said she doesnapost know what would have happened to herher dog hadnapost scared away a strange man following her in the early hours of the morning. Lorraine Scott was out with her dog in Wirral early this morning when she got spooked by a strange man approaching her car. Lorraine, who is from Birkenhead, was taking her German shepherd dog Toby for a run on Leasowe beach at around .am this morning when she got freaked out by a stranger following her.The -year-old told the Liverpool Echo : “I turned into the car park for the beach and I spotted this maroon car on my right hand side.“I carried on driving down towards the steps to the beach because it’s easier for the dog and parked by a vacant car.  “I then started to sort everything out, like get my wellies on and get Toby sorted and noticed that the maroon car must have turned around from the way he was facing when I drove in as it was pulling up beside the vacant car by me. “I knew whoever it was had seen that I was on my own when I drove past, but I didn’t think anything of it at this point.” Lorraine said she continued to prepare for her run when she noticed a man get out from the car and begin slowly making his way towards her. She said he was scanning the area intensely while walking towards Lorraine’s passenger seat. Lorraine said: “At this point I started to get really panicky and I just froze. “I couldn’t really do anything, I just froze.” The man continued to slowly approach Lorraine but it was at this point that three-year-old Toby saw him getting ‘too close’ and began to react to his ‘strange’ presence. Lorraine said: “Toby started barking and going mad at him and then straight away the man jumped and ran straight back into his car and drove away very quickly. “I’m just really happy I had my protector with me. He’s naturally a protective breed and because of our bond he will always protect me.”  Lorraine said the incident freaked her out as she has never been in a situation like that before and despite being trained in kickboxing she didnapost know how to react.Writing about the incident on a community Facebook page, Lorraine said: “If I had been on my own, this might have been a dferent story - luckily my German shepherd is protective of me.“Iaposve been at this beach before and never had anything like this happen and there is always people camping the night there so never usually though anything strange about people being parked up there. “Hopefully this post will make people aware there are some weirdos about and to be extra careful, so glad I have a German shepherd to protect me.” The man was said to be wearing a black tracksuit and and black crew neck t-shirt. He had a shaved head with blonde hair, was of a slim build and approximately ft  in height from what Lorraine could make out. Lorraine says she is still shaken up after the incident and in future she will continue to walk Toby with her husband like she would usually do. title: your booster jabs now avoid
story: Sajid Javid warns Brits to get booster jabs now to avoid Christmas Covid rulesSajid Javid, the Home Secretary, said that  we all come together and play our part then the country can avoid ato restrictions allowing everyone to enjoy ChristmasA patient receiving a Covid- vaccine booster, as urged by the Health Secretary Image: PAByLeigh Mcmanus:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov | comments Elderly and vulnerable people have been urged to get their Covid- booster jabs as part of a national mission to help dodge a restricted Christmas.Sajid Javid, the Home Secretary, said thatwe all come together and play our part then the country can avoid ato restrictions.So far, almost  million people in the UK have received a top-up jab, but the Department of Health and Social Care said that around  per cent of over-s and  per cent of over s in England are still yet to receive the booster shot. People over  and those most at risk from Covid- are eligible for a booster six months after their second jab, with  million more people in England being invited to have their booster jabs next week. Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here Mr Javid said: We know immunity begins to wane after six months, especially for the elderly and the vulnerable, and booster vaccines will top-up their protection to keep people safe over the winter. He added that younger relatives should urge eligible parents and grandparents to take up both the offer of a booster and a flu vaccine. Javid said: Almost  million people in the UK have received their Covid- booster and third jabs, a phenomenal achievement in under two months. “As we approach this milestone, I want to thank those who have come forward and urge everybody across the nation to get vaccinated, get protected and get boosted.  He went on: “I strongly urge everybody who is eligible for a Covid- booster or flu vaccine to take up the offer as soon as you can. “For those not yet eligible, please help your parents, grandparents or vulnerable loved ones get their jabs, it could save their le.“Andyou haven’t yet had your first and second vaccines, it is not too late, the NHS will always be there to welcome you with open arms.“This truly is a national mission. If we all come together and play our part, we can get through this challenging winter, avoid ato restrictions and enjoy Christmas.” It is possible that in the future, a third jab could become a requirement to avoid travel restrictions - a move which is expected to further drive the uptake of boosters.Government guidelines state that people who are  and over, or aged  and over with a health condition that puts them at high risk of contracting Covid-, and had their second dose six months ago are eligible to get their booster. By next week,  million invitations will have been sent since the NHS booster programme began. title: mystery travis scott concert crush
story: Mystery Travis Scott concert crush victim named as student, , by devastated familyOthers to have died in the horror crush at a Travis Scott concert at Astroworld in Houston, Texas, on Friday ranged in age from  to , Mayor Sylvester Turner said during a press conferenceAxel Acosta had travelled alone to visit his first concert festivalByWilliam WalkerNews Reporter:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov | commentsAnother victim of the deadly stampede at a Travis Scott concert that killed eight has been identied by his grieving family. Officials had released an image of a man in the hopes of identying him after his tragic death. It has since been confirmed by his family that the victim was -year-old Axel Acosta - he is the sixth of eight who died to have been identied. He died in a horror crush during a gig at Astroworld in Houston, Texas, on Friday. Others who died in the incident ranged in age from  to , Mayor Sylvester Turner said during a press conference. Other confirmed victims included a  and -year-old, and people aged from  up to . Mr Acostaaposs family said he was a -year-old Washington college student. The computer-science student at Western Washington State, had travelled alone to the performance, his family told KTRK-TV on Sunday.“It was his first time going to an event like that,” his aunt, Cynthia Acosta, said. He had just turned  last month, say reports. By all accounts, Axel was a young man with a vibrant future. We are sending our condolences to his family on this very sad day, said Western Washington University vice president of enrolment and student services Melynda Huskey. Officials with the Harris County Institute of Forensic Sciences had released an image of the man earlier, just  hours after the incident. Authorities have not yet released his cause of death. A total of  people were admitted to the hospital and  are still receiving treatment, including five under the age of . Other victims have already been identied.  One, Danish Baig, was  and killed after being crushed while trying to save a relative during the stampede at the concert.His death was confirmed by his brother, Basil, who shared a photograph of him via Facebook and branded him a “beautul soul” and commended him for his “courageous act”.The youngest victim has been named as -year-old John Hilgert. The teenager was described as a loveable baseball fanatic who was one of the nicest human beings. His baseball coach Justin Higgs paid tribute on Instagram : RIP John Hilgert. He got the Call up to the Major Leagues by the Almighty!John made an impact on anyone who met him and they always remembered him. I have memories of John I’ll never forget. University of Dayton student Franco Patino has also been confirmed as another of the victims – with the university releasing a statement about the -year-old’s death. Meanwhile, People confirmed that -year-old dancer Brianna Rodriguez was another of the eight killed in the tragedy. Her grieving family are quoted by the outlet stating that Brianna is: “Gone from our sites [sic], but never from our hearts.”And -year-old Rodolfo aposRudyapos Peña was confirmed as another one of the victims by the Laredo Morning Times. title: sacked amazon driver says woman
story: Sacked Amazon driver says woman sneaking out of his van is his partnerTywan George, the driver of the vehicle, revealed the woman in the video is his partner and insisted he was just doing his job. He was sacked after the video went viralThe mystery blonde woman emerging form the back of the Amazon vanByGraeme Murray:,  Nov | commentsA sacked Amazon driver says a woman seen sneaking out the back of his van is his partner - as he hinted at what really happened between them. In the bizarre clip, the woman is spotted crawling out of the back door of driver Tywan Georgeaposs van.The footage went viral on TikTok, and one week later Tywan was sacked.He has now revealed the woman in the video is his partner and insisted he was just doing his job.Tywan told a TMZ reporter in a video call: It was just a one time incident, but I did what any other man in America would do.  He continued: I felt like losing my job was the worse that they could do to me, there was no packages reported missing, nothing was reported stolen. It was just the incident went viral, thataposs what cost my my job. I kind of knew it too once Iaposd seen the video going viral, once it got a million views on TikTok, I kind of knew it because I know Amazon are strict. Answering questions specically about what he was doing in the back of the truck in the viral video, he said he was just doing his job. Filmed in July, , in a residential neighbourhood, of Florida, the clip shows the doors slowly being pushed open. A blonde woman dressed in a black dress and flip flops is then seen sneaking out the door and casually going on her way. She looks like she is taking a phone from her dress to make a call as she leaves the van.The clip emerged on TikTok and has gathered more than  million views.Users of the social networking  started going into a frenzy in the comment section and posted puns and innuendos about what had been going on. One poster wrote: Package will be delivered in  months. Thank you While another suggestive comment said: He was just showing her his package Others suggested it was a new service provided by the delivery giant: This is Amazons new back door service! news us-news travis-scott-concert-crush-witnesses-"Travis Scott ‘devastated’ at lives lost during Astroworld concertByWilliam WalkerNews Reporter:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov | commentsSurvivors of a horrying crush at a Travis Scott concert have claimed some in the crowd were feral and trampled on victims. Describing the horrendous incident a witness said that one of the eight who died passed away in his arms after the deadly stampede in Houston, Texas. The tragedy happened during a performance by rapper Travis Scott at a music festival he launched. More than a dozen people were rushed to hospital and at least eight people died in the crush at Astroworld Fest on Friday. A -year-old was among those hurt, officials said. Festivalgoers have gone on to describe the chaos as people surged to the front, with footage showing fans dancing on ambulances trying to reach those hurt. Speaking to CNN witness Selena Beltran said she saw the crowd act like animals at the event.She said she struggled to breathe as the crowd tightened and saw people trampling over unconscious people on the ground. She said: I fell backwards and it felt like it was the end for me. To think thataposs how Iaposll die, I was so scared. I did not know what to do.  It was all happening so fast, but so slow and I couldnapost react. I just screamed.I was shocked to see people act so inconsiderate and feral. It was insane to see so many just run others over like wild animals.People did not care, they still tried to squeeze through just to get to the front without thinking of the consequences and who it would affect.  She said looking around she thought aposthere was little humanity in that crowdapos and said she saw bodies of people she had performed CPR on being taken away by medics. Another man who was at the concert, Billy Nasser, said he saw people unable to breathe and call out for help. He told the outlet: I picked some kid up and his eyes rolled to the back of his head, so I checked his pulse. I knew he was dead. I checked the people around me. And I just had to leave him there, there was nothing I could do. I had to keep going. Kids were dropping left and right. An ICU nurse who went to the show, Madeline Eskins, said she had never seen anything like it.  TK Tellez, , said that people were trying to get help but nobody heard and called the incident horrying, adding: People were screaming for their lives, and they couldnapost get out. Nobody could move a muscle. Scott was onstage performing a set which included a guest appearance from rapper Drake when the fatal crush occurred.Officials said a crowd began to rush towards the stage at about .pm local time and revellers began passing out because they couldnapost breathe, KHOU reported.Anxious fans tried to get the attention of crew members by climbing onto a camera tower, video shows. Within  minutes, overwhelmed officials had declared a mass casualty incident because there were so many victims.  Houston Fire Chief Samuel Pena said hundreds of people were treated at the scene for injuries. The crowd began to compress toward the front of the stage, and people began to panic, he said. Mr Pena said there were around , people in the crowd when it happened. The remainder of the festival has been cancelled. In a statement Astroworld said: Our hearts are with the Astroworld Festival family tonight. We are focused on supporting local officials however we can. news weird-news beautician-horried-client-turns-up-"Lash technician horried by clients eyelash extensionsByEmma RosemurgeyAudience Writer:,  Nov | commentsThereaposs no better feeling than heading to the salon to get a fresh set of lashes, but while you might want to keep the price down, itaposs important to go to someone who knows what theyaposre doing. Of course, administering eyelash extensions is a very particular skill, and being so close to the eye, thereaposs a lot that can go wrong in the wrong hands. So, you can understand just how horried one lash technician was, when she had a client come in to have a set of botched lashes removed, after an unqualied beautician stuck them on using hair bonding glue. For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here.TikTok user IPS Beauty @ipsbeautytook to the app to share a clip of the botched lashes, insisting it should be illegal for any client to be left with their lashes in such a poor state.A client came in for a removal today, I was horried, the technician wrote on the clip. Extensions applied with hair bonding glue and zero isolation. This should be ILLEGAL! The beautician went on to explain how her client had been left with very few of her own lashes after trying to remove the extensions at home resulted in her pulling most of her lashes out. Ouch. Look at how sparse her natural lashes are. She came to me like this so the other lashes were probably ripped out, she wrote. Understandably, the beauticianaposs followers were also left horried over the lashes, with many accusing the person who did the botched job as a aposfakeapos. What is wrong with all these FAKE lash techs! If you can’t do it properly don’t do it, one follower commented, while another added: Iaposm still f**king learning and I can do better.Do you have a story to share  We want to hear all about it. news weird-news homeowner-thought-carpet-chic-grey-"HOMEOWNER THOUGHT CARPET WAS CHIC GREY COLOUR UNTIL HOUSE WAS PROFESSIONALLY CLEANEDByCourtney PochinSenior Audience Writer:,  Mar Updated:,  Nov | commentsWhen something has been left to get really dirty and disgusting, it can be rather satisfying to watch it get cleaned andto its proper state. Brandon Anderson, who helps professional cleaners find clients, recently showed off a video of someone doing just this to a filthy carpet. However, viewers who saw the clip on TikTok were horried by the sheer amount of dirt involved - as they initially just assumed that the carpet was a chic dark grey colour. But as the expert went at the fabric with a steam cleaner, the carpet can be seen to completely transform back to its original shade. And it wasnapost meant to be grey at all - it was in fact beige. The carpet had so much dirt and grime in it that it had darkened over time due to lack of care. Thousands of people have watched the clip, mesmerised by the cleaning process.  Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here. One person replied: But HOW ! Another said: This is why I HATE carpet. I donapost believe it, proclaimed a third. Someone  wrote: GROSS.  My eyes went from wide to wider, admitted a dferent user. A sixth person added: Throw away the whole house. Others thought that it was nasty and shared comments with the vomiting emoji. This comes after a dferent TikTok user had a similar experience with the laminate flooring in their new home. Posting under the name @dandycleans she uploaded a clip on to the social media  showing her scrubbing a section of her floor and as she wipes, it becomes lighter and lighter. The video was captioned: When I moved in I just thought the floor was dark. The floor initially did appear to be dark, but her hard work soon reveals the regular laminate flooring underneath. More than , people watched her clean, with over , liking it. However, some people werenapost quite so impressed, with a few wonderingsheaposd actually cleaned the floor or just removed the stain. But @dandycleans was quick to insist that it was laminate flooring and it really was just THAT dirty. Have you ever made a gross discovery like this  Let us know in the comments below. news weird-news i-thought-tinder-date-stood-"TikToker recalls finding Tinder date naked in his carByEmma RosemurgeyAudience Writer:,  Nov | commentsItaposs no secret that online dating can be a bit of a minefield, and more often than not, when do you meet up with a match, youaposre never entirely certain how itaposs going to go. Sometimes it can go great, but sadly, thataposs not always the case, and many daters have experienced being catfished, or arguably worse their date not showing up at all. One woman has revealed how she thought her date had done a runner halfway through their date, after he disappeared for  whole minutes after conveniently aposforgetting his wallet.aposTikTok user Ashleigh @hai_im_ashleigh_had been speaking to her date aposPaulapos for several months before they were able to finally meet up, due to conflicting schedules, but when he heard she was hanging out at a shopping centre near where he lived, he offered to come over and meet her.  Since Ashleigh was with a friend, Paul offered to treat them both to dinner and she admits he seemed to be a very nice guy. We met him at a LongHorn steakhouse - he shakes her hand and hugs me, she explained in a TikTok clip. Once we get to the door [of the restaurant], he starts patting his pants and goes aposoh my god, I left my wallet [in the car]. Go ahead and put our name on the waitlist.  For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here. More than  minutes later, Paul hadnapost come back, prompting Ashleigh and her friend to believe theyaposd been stood up, so they left and decided to get a McDonaldaposs instead. So I was sitting there, almost in tears, because I really liked this guy, she continued. And me and my friend just decide to leave and go grab some McDonaldaposs because I wasnapost really in the mood to get a steak dinner at that point. But, as they were leaving the restaurant, the pair noticed Paulaposs car parked up nearby, so Ashleighaposs friend decided to march up to the vehicle and confront him. My friend went up to the car and let out a scream, Ashleigh recalled, adding that she quickly ran over to see what all the fuss was about. Me being the nosy a** I am, went up to the car, looked in and saw this man butt a** naked. He just rolls down the window and says, aposdo you want to have a threesome apos Itaposs fair to say weaposd rather have been stood up.Do you have a story to share  We want to hear all about it. title: mum mortified after double spray
story: Mum mortied after double spray tan leaves her looking like Ross from FriendsDerrie Mathews asked her beautician to do her spray tan twice to counteract her pale complexion, but she woke up looking like Ross from Friends after his epic spray tan failDerrie asked the beautician to spray her twice because she was so pale Image: Derrie Mathews   SWNSByEmma RosemurgeyAudience Writer:,  Nov | commentsA mum has been left feeling mortied after a hilarious spray tan fail left her resembling Ross from Friends. Derrie Mathews had no one to blame but herself, after asking the beauticianshe could be sprayed twice, in a bid to compensate for her apossuper paleapos natural red head complexion. The -year-old went to get the £ treatment two days before a wedding in order to give her winter skin a warm, summer glow - but she couldnapost quite believe her eyes when she woke up the next morning. I was going to a wedding, and Iaposm super, super pale - I am really freckly and white. So, I just asked the girlshe would do it twice, so much darker, Derrie explained. At first, the mum didnapost notice much of a dference to her complexion and it wasnapost until she woke up the following day that she realised sheaposd made a huge mistake. Derrie said: You have to leave it on for eight hours and then wash it off after, and it was just getting darker and darker and darker. But I didnapost wash it off after eight hours because it stops developing then. On Friday morning, when she awoke and looked in the mirror, she couldnapost believe the shade that sheaposd turned, much to the amusement of her husband.  For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here. l was aghast at what I looked like. My husband couldnapost stop laughing, and my daughter was petried that anyone would see me. I knew I looked so ridiculous, so I didnapost tell him not to do it. I fully deserved everything! Derrieaposs double spray tan blunder is reminiscent of the famous Friends episode, in which Ross misunderstands the tanning booth, and ends up getting sprayed with two twos - twice! She said: When the girl did it, my friend was with me, and I was saying, aposIaposm an eight, Iaposm an eightapos because thataposs what Ross says! But despite her tanning experience not quite going to plan, Derrie hasnapost been put off spray tans and says sheaposll definitely be ing in the future. I will go back - it makes me feel better when I have a tan, she said. Itaposs nice to have a little bit of colour, but not the boot polish look - itaposs not for me, I must say.Do you have a story to share  We want to hear all about it. news weird-news nurses-mind-blown-mum-tells-"Nurse shares most unfortunate baby name shes ever heardByCourtney PochinSenior Audience Writer:,  Mar Updated:,  Nov | commentsWhen it comes to name pronunciation, itaposs no secret that there are some incredibly complicated and unique names out there. Then there are the more common names, that most people have absolutely no problem whatsoever saying out loud.However, every now and then it seems thereaposs a crossover between the two and this is where it gets tricky, as a parent takes a popular name and decides to alter the pronunciation - but keep the spelling the same.One woman has recounted an awkward situation she found herself in after getting a childaposs name wrong.Taking to TikTok, the nurse, known only as Lindsey, admitted that sheaposs bad with names but didnapost think she could butcher the name Liam after she saw it on a patientaposs file. She said: Iaposm a paediatric nurse and Iaposm from the deep, deep south, so I butcher everybodyaposs name. If itaposs not something super simple like Ben or Sally, Iaposm gonna butcher it. So, I see a kidaposs name on our computer and I say aposOh, Liam, I got this. L-I-A-M. Liam. Easyapos. I go out, call the kidaposs name, nobody moves. Call him again. Nobody moves. Call him again nobody moves. Finally this mum stands up and says aposDo you mean aposYum apos And I say aposNo, Liam apos and she said aposYeah, itaposs short for Williamapos. Lindsey finishes the video by doing a mind blown gesture, adding boom.Her clip went viral, being watched more than three million times and garnering over , likes.Thousands of people also commented, with one saying: My sonaposs name was Liam. His new name is Yum.Another replied: As a mum of a Liam, I am perturbed. Others began sharing unfortunate and amusing names theyaposd come across. Someone  said: Had a student named Justin, last name Case. He said aposMy mom thinks she has a sense of humourapos. Had a patient named L-A, I called for LA. Mom quickly informed me itaposs pronounced Ladasha and did I not see the dash  Ummm ok, added a dferent user.Whataposs the most unique name youaposve ever heard  Let us know in the comments below. title: woman sparks debate after scolding
story: Woman sparks debate after scolding strangers child in public restaurantA woman is receiving praise online after revealing how she scolded a strangers child for being rude in public - before receiving a bashing from the childs mumThe woman told the child not to take her stuff Image: Getty Images iStockphotoByEmma RosemurgeyAudience Writer:,  Nov | commentsEveryone has dferent ideas of what is right and wrong when it comes to parenting, especially in regards to disciplining, but is it ever okay to discipline a child who is not yours  A woman recently sparked an interesting debate on this subject, when she revealed she had aposscoldedapos a child who played with her belongings without permission in a public restaurant. The -year-old woman was out enjoying a meal with her family in a restaurant which was catered to families and young children, when a child aged around nine started yelling, running up and down the aisles and doing cartwheels. It was annoying but we just ignored him and carried on with our meal. His mother was sat at their table talking to the adults she was with and completing ignoring her son apart from occasionally telling him to come and finish his food, the woman wrote on Redditaposs Am I The A**hole forum.We were sat in a booth and I had my stuff on the bench next to me, including a hat. One of the many times he ran past our table, he stopped, picked up my hat and put it on. Just as the boy went to run off with the hat, the woman sharply told him, give that back right now, and he obliged, with an embarrassed look on his face. The woman went on to tell him it is extremely rude to take other peopleaposs things without asking, donapost do that again. The child then glanced over at his mum and caught her attention, prompting her to come over and see what was going on.  For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here. His mum heard part of what I was saying as she came up to us and angrily told me to leave her son alone I explained that he had taken my things and I was telling him not to, she explained. She told me I shouldnapost stick my nose in and that as heaposs aposjust a kidapos and that I should have just let him play with the hat, or asked for it back nicely without scolding him. The woman then turned to Reddit to question whether she was justied in aposscoldingapos the child, and she was met with overwhelming support. I have four kids and I would be absolutely appalledthey acted this way in public, one Reddit user commented, while another added: Kid needs to learn some manners somehow and it seems like his mum isn’t going to be the one teaching him how to act properly in public. Kids shouldn’t be allowed to run around inside a restaurant for any reason, let alone do cartwheels, a third wrote. They could knock someone’s food over, hurt themselves or someone who’s just trying to do their job or enjoy a meal out. Mum needs to learn to teach her kids to behave or someone  will.Do you have a story to share  We want to hear all about it. news world-news hazardous-asteroid-size-efel-tower-"Moment meteorite flies into Earths atmosphere in ByKetsuda PhoutinaneTrends Writer:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov | commentsAn asteroid as tall as the Efel Tower is coming towards Earth in December - but thankfully will pose no threat to humanity.Almost triple the size of a football pitch, the asteroid named  Nereus is classied as a aposPotentially Hazardous Asteroidapos , reports the Daily Record.NASAaposs asteroid monitor predicts it will come close to Earth on December . Impact from the asteroid could be devastating, but thankfully, it dose not pose a threat to the planet. The asteroid will fly by the planet at a distance of . million kilometres - a distance greater than  times of that between the Earth and the moon.  Nereus is  metres long, which makes it larger than % of asteroids, but tiny compared to large asteroids, according to Space Reference. The asteroid orbits the sun every  days though it is predicted not to come close to the Earth again until March ,  and then November . Its closest approach will not happen for another  years in February . Discovered in  by US astronomer Eleanor F. Helin, Nereus is a member of the Apollo group of asteroids which are known for crossing the path of the Earth as it orbits the Sun. Scientists have considered missions to the asteroid, but plans have fallen through each time.  NASA proposed sending the Robotic Asteroid Shoemaker Rendezvousprobe and Japan assessed sending the robotic spacecraft Hayabusa to Nereus, but both ultimately chose other targets. It is not the first time large asteroids have entered the Earthaposs orbit, however. In September, an asteroid larger than Big Benaposs clock tower was set to crash through the Earth’s orbit, travelling at incredible speeds of ,mph. The rock, designated RL, is between  feet to  feet wide, came within ,, miles of Earth. For comparison, the Moon is located just , miles away. The asteroid is measured to be close enough to be around  lunar distances away - trips to the moon and back. story: We are excited to announce a new home for the Eveningcontent online, with a bigger and better website in partnership with The Courier. We have spoken to our readers, and our aim is to deliver you everything that you need to know, together in one place.If you are a subscriber or thinking about joining our digital community, find out what it means for you below.In order to give you access to the news that you need, we have expanded our newsrooms and created dedicated news teams to serve you and our extended local communities across Tayside and Fe. We will deliver you more content, live news as it happens, as well as breaking crime news and the latest from court, together in one place. We have also found new ways of telling our stories online, from in-depth investigations through to full- documentaries and podcasts.There is no change to The Courier and the Eveningnewspaper or ePapers. The newspapers will continue to be available for purchase at your local store, delivered to your home, or as an ePaper . We will continue to deliver you the best stories in print, that you have come to expect from The Courier and the Evening .Our ePapers are a full replica version of the newspaper, published online,  days a week. You can access The Courier and the EveningePaper via our dedicated ePaper apps where you can save and share stories, access all the paper supplements easily via their dedicated menu and even play interactive puzzles!If you would like to find out more about subscribing to The Courier or the EveningePaper, please contact our Digital News Subscriptions Team on    Monday – Friday, am – pm, or email.Your subscription to The Courier will allow you to access all of the Eveningstories which are now available on The Courier website. All of the best Eveningcontent, including columnists and football analysis will now appear on The Courier website and will be available for you as part of your subscription. If you have an ePaper subscription there will be no change as to how you access your Courier ePaper.The new website is now live. Eveningcontent can now be found on The Courier website.When you purchased your subscription an email was sent to your account with your login details. To reset your password please use the following link.Please contact our Digital News Subscriptions Team, on    Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.Your subscription will continue as normal and all your existing subscriber benefits will remain in place. There are changes as to how you access your subscription benefits. See below, depending on what type of subscription you have.If you are an existing EveningWeb subscriber, you can log in to your account as normal through The Courier website.If you have an ePaper subscription you can access your ePaper on The Courier website here.Or via a new link in your Daily ePaper email.There is no change to your reoccurring billing agreement. If you purchase a new subscription through The Courier website the price is subject to change and may be more than your current subscription. If you have any questions about your current subscription or how to access your subscription benefits in the future, please contact our Digital News Subscription Team on   , or email.The new website is now live. Eveningcontent can now be found on The Courier website.Your subscription will continue as normal and all your existing subscriber benefits will remain in place. If you are an existing EveningWeb subscriber, you can log in to your account as normal through The Courier website here.If you have an ePaper subscription you can access your ePaper on The Courier website here.Or via a new link in your Daily ePaper email.Yes, your existing Eveninglogin details work on The Courier. To log in please visit www.thecourier login.If you have any problems logging in, please contact our Digital News Subscription Team on   , or email.When you purchased your subscription an email was sent to your account with your login details. To reset your password please use the following link.No, your existing reoccurring billing agreement will not change. If you cancel this agreement you can still purchase a new subscription in the future through The Courier website. The price is subject to change and may be more than your current subscription.If you need any advice about your current or future subscription options please contact the Digital News Subscription team, on    Monday # Friday, am # pm or via email.Please contact our Digital News Subscriptions Team, on    Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.The Eveningwebsite is no longer available. If you navigate to the Eveningwebsite or have website links saved, you will be automatically redirected to The Courier website.Yes. You will find all the content that you would have normally found at the Eveninghere .Our combined newsroom will deliver you all of the Eveningcontent that you would expect from The Tele website, plus more! We will continue to bring you the very best local news, football insight and in-depth features, as well as your favourite Eveningcolumnists. These can all be found on The Courier website as well as live news # updated as it happens # breaking crime news and the latest from the courts. You can also find our very best content that was published originally on the Eveningwebsite. These articles will be marked as originally appearing on the Eveningwebsite.Some Eveningcontent will be moved to The Courier website. Your bookmarked links will automatically redirect to the corresponding page on The Courier website.Yes, The Courier and the Eveningsocial pages will continue. We will curate content specically for our audiences through our Facebook, Twitter and Instagram channels. All articles will link to The Courier website.Your registration details that you set up on the Eveningwebsite will work on The Courier website. Please log in to your account as normal via the top right hand corner of the website or with this link.If you have forgotten your login or password please click the password reset link and follow the instructions.Yes. All registered users can access  free articlesevery  days. You now have access to  free articles on the new site. Please note, this information is correct at the time of publication, however, DC Thomson reserve the right to change this in the future.No, you will no longer receive Eveningbranded newsletters. You will now receive Courier newsletters. If you do not wish to receive these, click the #unsubscribe# link at the bottom of the newsletter email.The Courier has a Web subscription available which will give you access to all content on site from The Courier and the Evening . You can purchase a Courier Web or Courier ePaper subscription here: www.thecourier subscribeThe EveningePaper subscription is still available for purchase here.If you need help deciding what subscription is best for you, our Digital News Subscriptions Team are standing by to help. Please call on    Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.No, there is only one Web subscription available on The Courier. The Courier Web subscription will give you access to all content on site from The Courier and the Evening . You can purchase a Courier Web or Courier ePaper subscription here .If you have an existing EveningWeb subscription then all your subscription benefits are now available on The Courier site. You have access to a bigger and better website, with all your favourite Tele content plus more.If you need help deciding what subscription is best for you, our Digital News Subscriptions Team are standing by to help. Please call on    Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.You can purchase an EveningePaper subscription here.Yes, you can. Our ePapers are an exact digital replica of the newspaper and carry unique content in both titles. You can purchase both The Courier and the EveningePaper subscription’s here.

will continue to deliver great local news, in-depth sport coverage, plus a iety of quality features, as well as all your favourites like The Aberdonian, Society, At Home and Seven magazine.The very best of the Evening Express online will soon be available on The Press and Journal website and we look forward to welcoming you to our new online home very soon.To find out more about our exciting new combined website and what it means for you, please visit our Evening Express to Press and Journal FAQ page.

.dct-cta__grid:after.dct-cta--signup .dct-cta__label,.dct-cta--signup .dct-cta__btn.dct-cta--signup .dct-cta__gridgrid-template-columns:fr minmaxgrid-gap:.rem .remWith the Covid- vaccination programme now under way, we#ve put together a collection of Covid vaccine tracker charts to monitor the progress of the Covid- vaccine rollout across the UK.How many people have been vaccinated How many people have received the vaccine in my area Which demographics have received the vaccine What is the uptake like during pregnancy The Covid vaccine tracker below shows an at-a-glance view of the current proportion of the Scottish population who have received the first and second dose of either the Oxford AstraZaneca or the Pfizer BioNTech vaccination so far.Data on the number of people vaccinated was initially provided in a weekly report from Public Health Scotland, however there was immense pressure to keep the public more regularly informed so on January  the statistics began to be provided each day.The chart below shows the daily numbers of first and second doses provided.The chart below shows the cumulative number of people who have received each dose since the vaccination programme began on December .It#s also helpful to look at this data as a proportion of the Scottish population so you can see how the percentage of people vaccinated grows over time.The chart below shows the progress for each UK country.On January , Public Health Scotland provided this data broken down by vaccine type which is shown in the chart below.The map below shows the available data on the regional rollout of the vaccination programme.January  saw the release of data by local authority area for the first time, which is shown in the map below.Regional data was originally available on a weekly basis but moved to a daily upload on February . The chart below contains data on the daily number of doses provided and the population covered. Use the drop down box to select your area and the buttons to move between daily vaccinations, cumulative vaccinations and the percentage of the population who have received first doses.Similarly to the regional data, data by demographics were originally provided in the weekly PHS report # however on February  they moved to a daily publication schedule.The chart below shows the daily number of people who have had first doses in each age range as well as the percentage of that population covered.There is limited data available on vaccinations in pregnancy, however we do have monthly data on the number of people vaccinated by pregnancy trimester.Coronavirus in Scotland # track the spread with these charts" title"#Coronavirus in Scotland # track the spread with these charts# # Evening Express" src"https:www.eveningexpress fp news specials coronavirus-in-scotland-track-the-spread-in-these-charts-and-maps embed # secretanuYMBbtv" data-secret"anuYMBbtv" width"" "" frameborder"" marginwidth"" margin"" scrolling"no"Coronavirus in Scotland – here are the key demographics" title"#Coronavirus in Scotland – here are the key demographics# # Evening Express" src"https:www.eveningexpress fp news specials coronavirus-in-scotland-here-are-the-key-demographics embed # secretbLHWrhpUp" data-secret"bLHWrhpUp" width"" "" frameborder"" marginwidth"" margin"" scrolling"no"Let us knowthere is something  you think we should be tracking by emailing lkelly@dctmedia

story: Colin CameronUpdated:   , : amLikeGoogle +TweetEmailWant to  We value our content, so access to our full site is only available on subscription.Your subscription entitles you to -day-a-week access to our website, plus a full digital copy of that week#s paper to read on your pc mac or mobile device.And there#s more # your subscription includes access to digital archive copies from  onwards.Subscribe NowThis week we feature a series of photographs by Ardrishaig resident James Bowe.Taken on Friday October  during an early morning walk to Cairnbaan, James captured the scene as the sun rose on a beautul day after a spell of rain. title: argyllshire advertiser leader column november 5 2021
story: Updated:   , : amLikeGoogle +TweetEmailWant to  We value our content, so access to our full site is only available on subscription.Your subscription entitles you to -day-a-week access to our website, plus a full digital copy of that week#s paper to read on your pc mac or mobile device.And there#s more # your subscription includes access to digital archive copies from  onwards.Subscribe NowCaring for the carersThroughout the hardships and challenges of the pandemic, carers have become valued members of families who could barely have survived without them.Providing care for a person in their own home can be le-changing, offering them safety, independence and companionship.There can be few more vital roles to be played in society but are these invaluable people not themselves being supported Caring for the carers by investing in their teams, their working conditions and their pay must be the first priority of the mooted National Care Service, and in the meantime urgent action is needed to attract and retain staff in these crucial roles.When somebody chooses to train for this dficult, but hugely rewarding, career they should feel safe in the knowledge that they will be supported, paid a good wage and not be forced by shortages to offer anything other than the high quality, professional service they so badly want to deliver.RemembranceFor a hundred years communities across the UK have come together to honour all who have lost their lives in wars and military campaigns.These precious acts of remembrance were curtailed last year due to Covid restrictions, so perhaps this year it is more important than ever to head out to churches and cenotaphs all around our community, and together we will remember them.

title: massive-game-vale-raydale-park
story: VALE OF Leithen face arguably their biggest game in years this Saturday when they take on fellow Lowland League strugglers Gretna at Raydale Park.The Dumfries and Galloway side, who replaced manager Rowan Alexander with Stephen Hatfield last month, are currently six points ahead of Vale.New Vale head coach Grant Sandison is looking forward to the challenge after witnessing signs of encouragement against Edinburgh University in his first game in charge.After a string of heavy defeats, the club, with four new faces in the starting line-up, limited the students to three goals.But the Innerleithen side created a number of chances of their own and were unlucky to go in at half-time one goal down.Sandison told the Peeblesshire News: ldquoI was happy with the first-half performance against Edinburgh University."We set up to be organised and to stop conceding goals and I think we limited them to one shot before they scored from a direct free kick just before half-time. We created two or three good chances but in the second half we conceded early from a mistake and then ran out of steam but overall I was happy with the performance.ldquoWe had four players making their debut, Andrew Mackay, Ben Viola and Lewis Grahame who all signed from Penicuik and Ben Brady, who had just been released by St Mirren played as a trialist.ldquoBenpicked up an injury the second-half and had to go off. Hersquos had issues with his ankle all season and went over on it. He didnrsquot train on Monday night, so wersquoll see how he is for Saturday.ldquoWe have another three players lined up that we like the look of but whether they will be signed and available for Saturday, I donrsquot know right now. Hopefully one or two may be able to play.ldquoSaturday will be a massive game for the club. The Edinburgh Uni and Gretna games probably came a bit too early for us."It would have been betterwersquod had three or four weeks with the players first, but it is what it is. I watched Gretnarsquos Scottish Cup game against Berwick Rangers and have received some reports on them but they have a new manager so their style of play may have changed..removeldquoBut Irsquove been delighted with the response of the players so far. There has been a good reaction and there was a real enthusiasm in training. I am really looking forward to the game and it would be great to claw back some points to bring back up the road.
