title: lorna prichards howl comedy nights move paget rooms
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityThe line-up for thenight of Howl at its new Penarth premises" Popular comedy night s with new venue - everything you need to knowHeadliner Stuart Goldsmith " Popular comedy night s with new venue - everything you need to knowLorna Prichard" Popular comedy night s with new venue - everything you need to knowSarah Bridgeman" Popular comedy night s with new venue - everything you need to knowDon Biswas" Skip to next photo Show caption  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl" href" my account emailthispage " s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentA SELL-OUT comedy show, which will have you howling with laughter, is relaunching bigger and better than before.Howl comedy nights were founded by Lorna Prichard, starting at Cardfs Tramshed in .In  she left her job reporting for ITV Wales and ldquoswapped headlines for punchlines going into stand-up comedy Howlbecame a monthly event in Penarthrsquos Pier Pavilion in March .ldquoIt was very successful at Pier Pavilion, selling out to  maximum capacity most months, said Ms Prichard.ldquoI always try to curate a really ied, interesting line up of comedians, and my style of MCing is warm, energetic and a little bit chaotic, which seems to go down well."She planned to move the event to a bigger venue, with Penarth Town Council supporting the venture, then the Covid pandemic hit.Although live events were on hold, Ms Prichard kept busy shegot caught up in a whirlwind romance with a Brazilian called Leo ndash they dated long distance before meeting and getting engaged within  hours.ldquoThat descended into typical chaos, laughed Ms Prichard.ldquoI canrsquot wait to share my lockdown experiences with the audience.And share she will ndash with Howl ing for a monthly Saturday night show, with Glee Club level comedians, at Paget Rooms.ldquoIm so excited to be ing to Penarth, said Ms Prichard.ldquoBefore March  it was truly one of the highlights of my month.ldquoThe last  months have been so hard on us all, and we all need a laugh more than ever."Giving it a new home of the Paget Rooms means bigger shows with even bigger comedians, and I really hope Penarth is going to support us so I can keep coming back!Howl Comedy Night will , at the new venue, from .pm on Saturday November .Guests can expect an evening of fun, drinks, and laughter, featuring:STUART GOLDSMITH " alt"Penarth Times: Stuart Goldsmith " class"editor-image"Stuart Goldsmith An internationally award-winning comedian, writer, podcaster, and host. As seen on CBSrsquos Late Night With Conan OrsquoBrien, Russell Howardrsquos Stand Up Centraland As Yet Untitled ..removeHe is also the host of hit comedy podcast, The Comedians Comedian. With a reputation for smart, accessible stand-up, Stuartrsquos enthusiasm and natural charm conceal a quick wit and fearlessness.DON BISWASDon BiswasDon Biswas is one of the gems of the circuit. A politically charged gag merchant who likes to cover a wide range of subjects including his Asian upbringing, his dyspraxia and conspiracy theories.SARAH BRIDGEMANSarah BridgemanFor the last decade Sarah Bridgeman has been a hit with audiences all over the UK with her warm and friendly style. She has been a weird news commentator for BBC Radio Wales, a finalist for the Welsh national comedy competition WUSA , and has written a play based on her experiences in comedy.LORNA PRICHARDLorna PrichardLorna Prichard is a comedian from North East Wales. She is also a trusted broadcaster, having appeared regularly on TV and radio for the last  years. She can frequently be heard on BBC Radio Wales following the success of her weekly show, lsquoSummer Saturdays with Lorna Prichardrsquo.Since then she has been presenting in studio on a regular basis with rugby legends Jonathan Edwards and Nigel Owens, and covering for other presenters like Kiri Pritchard-McLean.Her warm, natural manner and charm endear her to audiences of all ages. She is a gted improviser who can keep her cool no matter what.Following the debut of Howl at Paget Rooms it willfora Christmas show on Saturday, December , with the line-up to be announced soon.Tickets for upcoming shows are available at ticketsource howl article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentComments: Our rulesWe want our comments to be a lively and valuable part of our community - a place where readers can debate and engage with the most important local issues. title: altered myths launch single  revamped ep
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local community is a creepy and twisted heavy pop song " Love letter to horror: New single launched by Vale rock duoAltered Myths are also headlining a gig at Vulcan Lounge in Cathays, Cardf lt spangtlt spangtlt spangt" Skip to next photo Show caption  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl" href" my account emailthispage " s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentJUST in time for Hallowersquoen a local band has released their horror-inspired single.Altered Myths ndash a double act featuring Matikwho lives in Penarth, and Eskaywho lives in Barry ndash have launched their new single: .The new song came out on Fridayand will be featured on an EP that they will release in the new year.Matik said: ldquo is our love letter to the horror genre we both grew up with.ldquoWe wanted to create a creepy and twisted heavy pop song and I believe that we have done that.ldquoWe spent the past  months reconnecting with ourselves and our music. We hibernated until the time was right.ldquoWeve been in Safehouse studio, in Oxford, putting together our next two EPs. We believe the world is ready to believe in us. will be the first track featured on the bandrsquos Revamped EPset to release in .The single includes a YouTube video, directed by Matik, which includes lyrics to the track, and graphics by Lee Waters.You can check it out at www.youtu.be ZlKxbMydncThe rockers, who have both been playing their instruments for more than  years, love performing to crowds ndash something thatrsquos been limited over the past  months due to the Covid pandemic.Matik has described their shows as an ldquoexhilarating clash of pantomime and mosh-pit therapy and people can get their fix at Altered Mythsrsquo upcoming headline show.They will be at Vulcan Lounge, in Cardf, on November  with support band Mawpit. The show will kick-off at pm, with tickets for pound on the door. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentComments: Our rulesWe want our comments to be a lively and valuable part of our community - a place where readers can debate and engage with the most important local issues. title: llantwit major waterspout weather gets spooky
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityJames Thomas, , an agent in the watersports industry, spotted the unusual phenomenon at Llantwit Major Beach in south Wales on Saturday morning.ldquoAs I stood there watching, I thought to myself, this is probably the best example of a waterspout that I will ever get to see in my letime, Mr Thomas told the PA news agency.ldquoOver the years I have seen quite a few of these over the Bristol Channel, but this was by far the biggest.Also known as funnel clouds or tuba, waterspouts form when a rotating column of wind draws in cloud droplets, according to the Met Office.Mr Thomas said he spied Saturdayrsquos weather spectacle while watching a surfing contest.ldquoIt started off fairly small, and quite high in the sky, and as we continued to watch, it appeared to get darker and began angling itself towards the surface of the sea, asit was coming towards us, he said.ldquoI quickly realised it was a waterspout when I could see the rotating spray on the waterrsquos surface, like a magnetic energy.ldquoI was shouting to all the competitors to look up and see this phenomenal natural occurrence.The sighting comes as the Met Office warned parts of the UK may have seen tornadoes on Sunday, as strong winds and rain batter the country.Gusts of over mph have been recorded and yellow warnings for wind and rain are in place over large parts of the west and where. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentComments: Our rulesWe want our comments to be a lively and valuable part of our community - a place where readers can debate and engage with the most important local issues. title: help support bereavement
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityBrought to you byNEWSQUEST COMMERCIAL CONTENTSponsoredHelp and support through bereavementHere are of the best funeral directors that will offer just that and more.Green Willow FuneralsGreen Willows Funeral Home arealways at the heart of the community and the directors of Green Willow Funerals give their expertise, time and governance in a voluntary capacity. Their motivation is to ensure bereaved iniduals and families receive personal, respectful and affordable services and to ensure company profits are donated for charitable purposes.Furthermore, the directors set and promote an ethos and standards to which:The company and its staff will provide a transparent, compassionate service to its clients and the families that it serves.The approach to the client will be client-centred and, at all times, impartial professional advice will be provided, giving the client all options possible.We will enable and support the client and empower them to be the decision maker and, having provided the required information, ensure the client understands why they have made those decisions and that it remains appropriate to their needs.We will maintain professional fees that meet the needs of the company and its commitments and reflect the services provided however, these charges are not purely profit driven and are levied at a rate that provides a cost effective option to the clients and the communities that we serve when they are compared to the charges made by the companyrsquos competitors.All clients, regardless of gender, faith or belief are treated as equals. Green Willow Funerals is also an equal opportunity employer.As a company owned by a Christian and charitable body, the Cardf YMCATrust, the company and its staff aim to maintain and uphold in all matters Christian principles and teachings, althoughtheyare not required to be practising Christians.Phone: Newport |  Website:greenwillowfuneralsPark Funeral DirectorsWe continue to provide professional and respectful funeral services from our independent funeral homes situated in Barry, Vale of Glamorgan. Our establishment has been serving the local community for many years now. Park Funeral Directors are committed to ensuring your lost loved one receives the dignied and heartfelt send-off they deserve.Not to mention, your familyrsquos needs are our top priority, and we go above and beyond to ensure final wishes are met. As an independent, family-run funeral directors, we offer that extra personal touch to make sure the funeral service is as special as you envisage.We will bring your loved one into our care at either our Barry or Penarth site. Here, they will be treated with the utmost dignity and respect until the day of the funeral. Our facilities also offer tasteful and comfortable rest roomsin which you can spend time with the deceased in peace and solitude. Here, you will be able to share final moments of prayer or reflection with the deceased while in a safe and private setting. Our experienced staff will then guide you through the process of arranging the funeral, including sourcing memorials, flowers and stationery.We are committed to fulfilling the final requests of the deceased and their families. Therefore, you can rest assurethat any final requests will be followed to the letter wherever possible. If you have a funeral plan, your wishes will be carried out in accordance with your package.Alternatively, pre-determined requests of the deceased as well as those of the next of kin will be carried out. Our promise to you is that every funeral delivered by Park Funeral Directors will be conducted with the utmost in dignity and respect at all times.Phone:Barry |    Penarth |   Email:barry@parkfuneralsWebsite:parkfuneralsBrought to you byNEWSQUEST COMMERCIAL CONTENT s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"Comments: Our rulesWe want our comments to be a lively and valuable part of our community - a place where readers can debate and engage with the most important local issues. title: st athan railway station considered
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityVale of Glamorgan Council has commissioned a consultancy firm to investigate the possibility of creating a railway station in St Athan.In the past there were two train stations based near the village Gileston and St Athan Road, but these are closed. A third railway station, named St Athan despite being three kilometres to the west of the village near Boverton also no longer operates.But with the Vale of Glamorgan Line reopening in  and new stations located at nearby Llantwit Major and Rhoose Cardf International Airport, the Council wants to explore whether there is an opportunity to re-establish a station near St Athan.Consultants Arcadis will look at an area around a section of the B, Barry to Llantwit Major Road, to determinea suitable site exists.They will consider many factors, including:Those relating to environmental featuresLand informationPlanning constraintsStation requirements, such as vehicle, pedestrian, and cycle accessCllr John Thomas, Vale of Glamorgan Council Ward Member for St Athan, said:ldquoIrsquom delighted that we are looking into the possibility of locating a railway station at St Athan."It has been a long time since one existed in the village and with the local population growing it is sensible that we look into expanding public transport services.Cllr Peter King, Vale of Glamorgan Council Cabinet Member for Neighbourhood services and Transport, added:ldquoI understand the appetite for a railway station in St Athan so we have commissioned consultants to determine whether such a move is feasible.ldquoIncreasing the use of public transport is in keeping with the Councilrsquos Project Zero initiative to reduce carbon emissions so this is something we are very interested in investigating.Once Arcadis have completed the study, their findings will be reported, and the Council will consider whether to take the matter forward. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey title: wales vs south africa autumn nations match   stream watch tv
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityThe hosts take on World Champions South Africa just seven days after their - defeat to New Zealand.However, unlike in that game, recent history favours Wales when it comes to South Africa.Wales have toppled the Springboks four times in a row at home, with South Africa last departing the Welsh capital victorious eight years ago.Credit: PAldquoWe are always trying to develop our game, said centre Davies, who took over captaincy duties when Alun Wyn Jones went off injured after just  minutes of the New Zealand encounter.ldquoThe one thing this team always shows is that the more time we spend together, the better we get.ldquoWe will dust ourselves off, come in on Monday and look to build and get a result next week at home.ldquoItrsquos the fine details ndash not moving forward on kicks, executing our exits correctly and not putting pressure on ourselves.Credit: PAldquoThe way South Africa play, they want to put pressure on you. For us, itrsquos making sure we build and play in the right areas of the field.ldquoLook, you work extremely hard to get a result, and when you donrsquot get it, it does hurt.ldquoThe beauty of it now is we have another opportunity next week to put the wrongs right. That is what this group will want to show next week.How to watch Wales vs South AfricaThe only way to watch Wales vs South Africa live this year is with Amazon Prime Video.The streaming service secured a new deal to exclusively broadcast Walesrsquo autumn games.All teams, except for Ireland who will be broadcast on Channel , will have their games shown behind the paywall.Amazon Prime costs pound. per month.Credit: PAUsually, Walesrsquo games would also be shown live on SC, however, with Amazon offering a Welsh language service, there will be no live coverage on the free-to-air channel..removeHighlights of all Wales matches will be shown on the evening of the test, with the South Africa highlights starting at .pm on Saturday.Walesrsquo Autumn Nations Series fixturesWales  -  New ZealandWales v South Africa, Principality Stadium, November , .pm kick off, Amazon Prime VideoWales v Fiji, Principality Stadium, November , .pm kick off, Amazon Prime VideoWales v Australia, Principality Stadium, November , .pm kick off, Amazon Prime Video article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentComments: Our rulesWe want our comments to be a lively and valuable part of our community - a place where readers can debate and engage with the most important local issues. title: new building replace bowling pavilion belle vue park
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communitynew" New community building in Penarth park to get ‘hundreds of users a week’old" Skip to next photo Show caption  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl" href" my account emailthispage " s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentA NEW community building in a Penarth park is set to get hundreds of users a week, according to council bosses.The new building will replace the current bowling pavilion in Belle Vue Park, in Albert Crescent.Vale of Glamorgan councilrsquos planning committee approved permission for the replacement building last week.Councillor Kathryn McCaffer, cabinet member for leisure, arts and culture, said: ldquoThe new building will encourage a wide range of community groups to be able to use the space. Anyone who has attended a meeting or event in the current building can attest to how uninviting and inaccessible it is, and freezing cold.ldquoWhile itrsquos sad that the existing, dilapidated building needs to be demolished, it has had a long le which has mainly benefited the bowling club."I welcome the building of a new pavilion as a way to ensure the whole community is supported for future generations, so we can keep adding to the history of this location.David Knevett, operational manager for leisure and tourism, did not answer questions on the cost of the works, but expects hundreds of users each week.He said: ldquoThe new building is a considerable investment, and leisure services are keen that itrsquos used to its full potential. By combining community use, the use of the bowlers, and events, we are confident this can be achieved.ldquoWe feel the building provides a springboard for more community activity to take place in this area of Penarth. Wersquore really excited about this project and the opportunity this building will represent."A signicant amount of the cost is being funded through Section , and wersquove been fortunate enough to secure a grant from the lottery for this building.The new community building was welcomed by a local community group, Friends of Belle Vue, who took part in public consultations and fed into the final designs.The Friends Theo Hodgkinson said: ldquoWersquore really excited to see the positive impacts of having a purpose-built facility that is accessible to all age groups. Wersquore also excited about the energy-saving credentials of the building." article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentComments: Our rulesWe want our comments to be a lively and valuable part of our community - a place where readers can debate and engage with the most important local issues. title: gannett foundation cash charities motion control dance
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityMotion Control Dance caters to all ages and abilities lt spangtlt spangt" Motion Control Dance shortlisted for Gannett Foundation Cash for CharitiesMotion Control Dance is based in YMCA Barry " Motion Control Dance shortlisted for Gannett Foundation Cash for CharitiesMotion Control Dance has been serving the community for two decades lt spangtlt spangt" Motion Control Dance shortlisted for Gannett Foundation Cash for CharitiesMotion Control Dance caters to people all across the Vale of Glamorgan lt spangtlt spangtlt spangt" Motion Control Dance shortlisted for Gannett Foundation Cash for CharitiesMotion Control Dance aims to keep people healthy and avoid them feeling isolatedltspan classtruncategtltspan classtruncate-previewgt lt spangtlt spangtlt spangt" Motion Control Dance shortlisted for Gannett Foundation Cash for CharitiesMotion Control Dance was given charity status in  lt spangtlt spangt" Skip to next photo Show caption  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl" href" my account emailthispage " s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentYOUR favourite local paper is giving local charities the chance to take a share of a whopping poundk cash giveaway.Our parent companyrsquos charitable arm, The Gannett Foundation, is providing pound, in cash to support local charities across the country - and we are delighted to have a pound, share to give away in our area.And we asked YOU to decide where this money should be spent. You nominated in your thousands and our editorial team chose a shortlist of eight charities from these nominations that will share in the pound,.In Wales the shortlist is:Motion Control DanceSparkleHelping Caring TeamWish Upon a StarPhoenix Bereavement SupportEthos - Extending The Hand Of Support .Chard  District MuseumSt Giles Animal RescueMotion Control Dance, based in the Vale of Glamorgan, was set-up by dance tutor Emma Mallam and aims to enrich the lives of people through movement." alt"Penarth Times: Motion Control Dance caters to people all across the Vale of Glamorgan " class"editor-image"She was teaching dance in England when her husband was diagnosed with a terminal brain tumor and the couple ed to Wales.ldquoI set up dance classes to keep myself busy, said Ms Mallam.ldquoI wanted to make a dference through movement as I watched my husband deteriorate and helped him by doing exercises and dancing with him to keep up his spirits.She sadly lost her husband in  and, along with looking after her baby, created a fulltime job doing giving people a ldquoChance  Dance.In  she became the dance development officer for the Vale with Vibe Experience and in  ndash addressing a lack of disability dancing provisions in the Vale ndash Local Motion Dance was introduced." alt"Penarth Times: Motion Control Dance was given charity status in  " class"editor-image"ldquoThis made us unique as we focused on community dance - using dance to help expression, confidence, self-esteem and to reduce isolation - rather than focus on exams and technical development, said Ms Mallam.Motion Control Dance - which gained charity status in  and is based at a studio in the YMCA Hub in Barry - caters to all ages and abilities, including older people. It caters for those with dementia, Parkinsonrsquos, the disabled, and mainstream groups..removeOver the past two decades they have worked with more than , iniduals each year, working in partnership with the Vale of Glamorgan Council and The Vale Youth Service, and delivering dance workshops." alt"Penarth Times: Motion Control Dance aims to keep people healthy and avoid them feeling isolated " class"editor-image"ldquoI am delighted how far Motion Control Dance has come, added Ms Mallam.ldquoWe have a team of experienced dance tutors who nurture the personal and social growth of our members.ldquoWe have employed two young people to undertake social media and administration and are training four young dance leaders to lead sessions - we want to provide opportunities for young people.ldquoWe also offer movement sessions for adults and older people this increased our mission to tackle social isolation in the community and give everyone a Chance to Dance.ldquoThe end of  saw our room be transformed into a fully equipped dance studio with a new sprung floor ensuring we are enriching lives through movement. Motion Control Dance is now thriving in our community.She is ldquoabsolutely thrilled to be one of eight chosen Welsh charities and has thanked the community." alt"Penarth Times: Motion Control Dance is based in YMCA Barry " class"editor-image"Money would help Motion Control Dance recover their services for older people in the Vale during the Covid pandemic classes went virtual.ldquoWe built a busy programme in , but since Covid we have been unable to run our full programme indoors at our studio or at care homes and community centres, said Ms Mallam.ldquoMany vulnerable adults and older people requiring care are continuing to self-isolate or are too fearful to attend indoor activity to be responsive to a iety of restrictions imposed we need financial support, so we can deliver an accessible movement programme for older people which can be taken to people and adaptive to their needs.ldquoOur goal is to reduce social isolation and prevent more costly health and social care needs by improving the health and wellbeing of iniduals through access to regular physical, creative and social activity." alt"Penarth Times: Motion Control Dance has been serving the community for two decades " class"editor-image"Now we are putting the power to allocate the cash back into the hands of our readers ndash during November, you are invited to collect tokens from our newspapers which can then be sent to collection points across our region or posted.Each token collected will then be used to allocate cash to the nominated charity - soyour favourite charity collects  per cent of all the tokens collected, it will receive  per cent of the pound,.Collection points are at:WH Smith, Windsor Road, PenarthTown News Xtra, Holton Road, BarryMCD Studio, YMCA Hub, Court Road, Barry. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentComments: Our rulesWe want our comments to be a lively and valuable part of our community - title: wales mps making thousands extra cash
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityThe most recent parliamentary Register of Members Interests shows that MPs accepted tickets to sporting and music events worth hundreds of pounds, while others engaged in highly paid consultancy work for global firms.Since April , the basic pay for a Member of Parliament has been pound, per year. On top of this, MPs are permitted to make expense claims for their commute between Parliament and their constituency.They also receive heavily discounted food and drink at parliament, subsidised by public money.Yet many MPs in Wales continue to accept lucrative work from private companies alongside their role as an elected representative, hold shares in private companies, and accept valuable gts.Perhaps the most high profile example this past year was Alun Cairns, MP for the Vale of Glamorgan, and Secretary of State for Wales before his  resignation over an aidersquos involvement in the sabotage of a rape trial.:Disgraced Rob Roberts is given back Tory membershipMr Cairns accepted consultancy roles at BBI Group, a Caerphilly-based ldquoglobal le science and diagnostic company and at Veezu Holdings Ltd, a Newport-basedldquoprivate hire transport and technology  which owns Dragon Taxis, last year.BBI Group is a partner on the UK governmentrsquos Rapid Test Consortium and was contracted to provide lateral flow Covid- antibody tests in October .Mr Cairns earns approximately pound per hour for his work ldquoproviding strategic advice to the Board at the firm, totalling pound, per year on top of his MP salary. He makes the same amount for his role at Veezu. has three consultancy jobs on top of his role as MP. " alt"Penarth Times: Alun Cairnshas three consultancy jobs on top of his role as MP. " class"editor-image"Alun Cairnshas three consultancy jobs on top of his role as MP. This year Mr Cairns also accepted employment at Singapore-based asset management company Elite Partners Capital, which owns a number of UK commercial properties rented out by the government..remove:Jane Dodds MS says a UBI needs ambition to become a realityOn its website the company boasts: ldquoEighty-five percent of the assets are based in town centre locations and are core locations occupied by UK Government.ldquoSecured top grade tenant with over % of the income secured by the UK Government.Mr Cairns sits on the All Party Parliamentary Group on Singapore, which aims to ldquopromote and advance relations with Singapore. He earns approximately pound per hour in his role as a strategic consultant for Elite Partners Capital, adding up to pound, a year.Cairns also sits on the APPGs for Taxis and Financial Markets and Services.This Govt should always be there to support those who need help but the days of blank cheque benefits are over. #welfarepartymdash Alun CairnsJuly , A tweet by Mr Cairns from  reads: ldquoThis Govt should always be there to support those who need help but the days of blank cheque benefits are over. #welfarepartyldquoAll [my] roles have been scrutinised and approved by Parliamentrsquos independent advisory body, ACOBA, he told The Nationaltoday.Many of Mr Cairnsrsquo Welsh Conservative colleagues also registered extra income streams.:Westminster is in effect a free-for-allVale of Clwyd MP Dr James Davies, who practiced as a GP before entering Parliament, has, the parliamentary Register of Membersrsquo Interests shows, continued to work occasional shts - including NHS out of hours work.But while former Cabinet Minister Cairns is able to collect a pound, salary for  hoursrsquo work, Dr Davies had to put in  hours as a GP ndash spread over  months ndash to earn around the same amount." alt"Penarth Times: Dr James Davies, MP for Vale of Clwyd, made more than poundk working as a GP and received pound, from telecomms company IX Wireless " class"editor-image"Dr James Davies, MP for Vale of Clwyd, made more than poundk working as a GP and received pound, from telecomms company IX Wireless Current Welsh Secretary Simon Hart accepted pound, from Landsker Business Club this February. The Club is registered as an "unincorporated association" such groups are able to direct signicant funds to politicians without disclosing the identities of their members. The practice is legal.Hart received a further pound, from hwe Ltd, a strategic comms company.:Wales can lead the way on electoral reformThis past year Virginia Crosbie, Conservative MP for Ynys Mocircn, accepted pound, in donations from the Cayzer Trust, which manages the commercial interests of the billionaire Cayzer family. The trust owns controlling shares of financial giant Caledonia Investments.Crosbie also received a pound, donation in-kind from trust fund manager and Conservative stalwart Patrick Evershed in May this year. The money was received indirectly through a Conservative Party organisation." alt"Penarth Times: Ynys Mon MP Virginia Crosbie was elected in . " class"editor-image"Ynys Mon MP Virginia Crosbie was elected in . Mr Evershed is the president of the Cities of London and Westminster Conservative Association, and has previously told interviewers that he owns a cottage in north Wales.In all, Virginia Crosbie registered gts worth pound, over the past year. She also earnedpound, completing surveys for companies YouGov, Ipsos MORI and Yonder but all of those fees were paid directly to charity.She said, via email: ldquoI regularly receive donations and I use the money for the benefit of my constituents.ldquoFor example, I used one donation to pay for the distribution of a leaflet across the island on mental health. Other future initiatives in a similar vein will also use donations.ldquoI make no apology for using this money to help all my constituents on Anglesey.:What will the census show us about the state of Welsh This week both Ms Crosbie and Alun Cairns voted in favour of throwing out the current parliamentary standards watchdog, which investigates rule breaches and conflicts of interest, after the body recommended the suspension of MP Owen Paterson. Westminster later u-turned on the decision.MP for Bridgend Jamie Wallis receives more than pound, per year in rent from commercial properties in Bridgend. He also holds signicant shares in sixteen dferent companies, some worth thousands of pounds.Mr Wallis said:ldquoFollowing my election as the MP for Bridgend I resigned all my Company Directorships. Media, music and Clement AttleeA handful of Welsh MPs earn additional income from writing articles and books, while one even earned extra cash for performing in a rock band." alt"Penarth Times: Chris Bryant chairs the committee which found MP Owen Paterson had engaged in lobbying on behalf of companies that were paying him. " class"editor-image"Chris Bryant chairs the committee which found MP Owen Paterson had engaged in lobbying on behalf of companies that were paying him. Chris Bryant, Rhondda MP and Chair of the Parliamentary Standards Committee, has authored a number of books and also regularly contributes articles to publications such as The Daily , Theand Attitude.In addition to his MP salary, the Labour member earned an extra pound, , with fees ranging from pound for three hours presenting an LBC radio programme to pound, for the film rights to his book, The Glamour Boys.Bryant also picked up pound, in March for giving a talk on his book at an LGBTQ+ webinar organised by American investment bank Goldman Sachs.:Festival marks  Chartist Newport Rising anniversaryShadow Home Secretary and Torfaen MP Nick Thomas Symonds registered pound,. in additional income, with pound, apparently for legal services provided before entering parliament in .The remainder was made up of royalties for biographies that the former Oxford lecturer had written on Nye Bevan and Clement Attlee before entering parliament.According to his website, the Torfaen MP is currently working on his third book ndash a biography of former Labour PM Harold Wilson.Meanwhile, Kevin Brennan, MP for Cardf West, was paid pound. last November for a performance with his band ldquoMP at television writer Matt Fordersquos  Christmas Special stage show in London." alt"Penarth Times: MP Kevin Brennan released an album called Cross Party with his band of fellow MPs in . " class"editor-image"MP Kevin Brennan released an album called Cross Party with his band of fellow MPs in . Described as ldquothe worldrsquos only parliamentary rock band, MP consists of guitarist Brennan, SNP MP Pete Wishart on keyboards, Conservative and lead singer Sir Greg Knight, and former Labour MP Ian Cawsey.New Pontypridd MP Alex Davies-Jones, who sits on the APPGs for Music Education and Media, accepted Brit Awards tickets and hospitality worth pound from Google, as well as a pound ticket to the Ivor Novello music awards from the Betting and Gaming Council.Similarly, Jo Stevens, Cardf Central MP and Shadow Culture, Media and Sport Secretary, accepted nearly pound, in sporting event and music award tickets.:Starmers private sector optimism is out of dateSome Labour MPs also earned thousands completing surveys. Mark Tami, MP for Alyn and Deeside, earned more than pound, in a matter of months.And the rest Not all MPs reported extra income streams.One such MP, Cynon Valleyrsquos Beth Winter, told The National: ldquoBeing the MP for Cynon Valley is a great privilege. It is also a very time consuming and extremely well paid job.ldquoI fail to understand why any of my colleagues should feel the need to do second jobs, or where they find the time.ldquoMPs should be focused on serving their constituents, not lining their own pockets working for big business. Second jobs for MPs must be banned." alt"Penarth Times: Labour MP Beth Winter says second jobs for MPs should be banned, " class"editor-image"Labour MP Beth Winter says second jobs for MPs should be banned, Plaid Cymru MP for Ceredigion, Ben Lake, added: ldquoI find that my duties as an MP keep me busy enough, and so have never sought [extra income].Other MPs reporting no additional financial interests included Preseli and Pembrokeshire MP Stephen Crabb, Newport East MP Jessica Morden, Aberconwy MP Robin Millar and Arfon MP Hywel Williams.All named MPswere approached for comment.If you valueThe Nationalsjournalism, help grow our team of reporters bybecoming a subscriber.Are you sure you want to delete this comment Yes, delete the commentNo, keep the commentReport This CommentGet involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. title: three lifeboat launches one afternoon cardiff bay

launches in one afternoonA fishing vessel was towed in to Cardf Bay by a leboat" Leboat volunteers have busy Saturday with three launches in one afternoonIt was a busy day for volunteers at the RNLI" Skip to next photo Show caption  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl" href" my account emailthispage " s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentLIFEBOATS were launched three times in one afternoon after sailors experienced some trouble near Cardf Bay.Volunteer RNLIcrews responded to the calls for help on Saturday, November .The first call came in at pm, with a  foot yacht running aground at low tide.A D-class leboat approached and ensured all four people on the yacht were safe, before securing the boats anchor and ing to their station.The leboat ed later on as the yacht refloated as the tiderose to ensure the wellbeing of all people on the boat and to provide assistancenecessary.At .pm, a fishing boat broke down and Milford Haven Coastguard requested that leboat crews attend.The crew were almost finished for the day after washing down the boat and gathering their things to go home.Nevertheless, they attended the scene in anAtlantic  leboat.The fishing vesselhad begun to drt out before droppingits anchor.It was towed in to Cardf Bay by the leboat crew. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey title: german covid infection rate reaches new high vaccinations slow
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityThe national disease control centre, the Robert Koch Institute, said the country has seen . new cases per , residents over the past seven days. That was above the previous record of . from December  last year.While it is still a lower rate than in several other European countries, the figure has set alarm bells ringing.The seven-day infection rate has long ceased to be the only yardstick for Covid- policy in Germany, but officials say hospitals are filling up in badly affected areas.The disease control centre said on Monday that , new cases were reported over the past  hours ndash down from a record , on Friday, but figures are typically lower after the weekend.Germany has struggled to find ways to pep up its slowing vaccination campaign. At least % of the population of  million is fully vaccinated, according to official figures, which authorities say is not enough. vw,vw,px, px"A woman walks past an abandoned coronavirus test centre in Frankfurt Unlike some other European countries, it has balked at making vaccinations mandatory for any professional group.As at many times during the pandemic, Germany has a patchwork of regional rules. Most places restrict access to many indoor facilities and events to people who have been vaccinated, have recovered or been tested mdash with the latter now being excluded in some areas. Enforcement of these rules is often lax.Rules on whether schoolchildren must wear masks in class y from state to state.Free rapid tests for all were scrapped nearly a month ago in an effort to incentivise more people to get vaccinated.There are now widespread calls for them to be reintroduced. And officials now advocate booster vaccinations for everyone who got their initial shots six months ago or more.Germany currently has a caretaker national government following the election in September..removeThe parties expected to form the next government plan to bring legislation to parliament this week that would allow an ldquoepidemic situation of national scope, in place since March , to expire at the end of the month, while providing a new legal framework for coronavirus measures..push,i[r].l*new Dateas,ms[]a.asynca.srcgmgagagagagagagagagagaga, title: German Covid infection rate reaches new high as vaccinations slow article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentComments: Our rulesWe want our comments to be a lively and valuable part of our community - a place where readers can debate and engage with the most important local issues. title: aldi donating food charities christmas   get involved
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityFood that does not sell in stores will be donated to local charities rather than go to waste.As part of Aldirsquos pledge to donate  million meals this year to families across the UK facing hunger, the supermarket has committed to donate more meals over the festive period.Christmas is a great time for organisations to benefit from Aldirsquos partnership with Neighbourly, a community engagement  that links businesses to food banks and charities.This enables Aldirsquos UK stores to donate surplus food seven days a week, all year round.Aldi stores will be closed on Christmas Day, Boxing Day and New Years DayWith all Aldi stores set to close on Christmas Day, Boxing Day and NewYearrsquos Day, the retailer wants to ensure that any products approaching the end of their shelf-le reach wont be wasted and can be given to families who might otherwise miss out this Christmas.Charities, food banks and community groups who could benefit from the scheme are encouraged to get in touch and register now for a festive food donation from the supermarket.Existing charity partnerships will be prioritised for these festive collections, but where therersquos availability, additional organisations are being invited to apply to be paired with a local Aldi store to collect fresh and chilled food products ndash including fruit, vegetables, fresh meat, fish and bread ndash ahead of stores closing on both Christmas Eve and New Yearrsquos Eve.Did you know you can get your remembrance poppy in your local Aldi Heres a few of the things were doing to remember our fallen heroes.## #ArmisticeDay #RemembranceSunday pic wsbUgZsKHmdash Aldi Stores UKNovember , Mary Dunn, Managing Director of Corporate Responsibility at Aldi UK, said: ldquoOur food donations scheme operates year-round, but we know that Christmas can be a particularly dficult time for the families and communities we support..removeldquoThatrsquos why we are so committed to increasing the number of meals we donate over the festive season, and we look forward to working with local charities this Christmas to help us meet our  million meals target for the year.Steve Butterworth, from Neighbourly, added: ldquoWith the impact of the pandemic still being felt by communities up and down the country, charities and local causes are eaxpecting record demand for their services this Christmas.ldquoWersquore sure there are lots more groups out there that could put this food to good use, so wersquod encourage them to get in touch.Organisations do not need to be a registered charity to apply but must:Have a level two hygiene certicate gained in the last two yearsBe able to transport and store chilled food products after collecting them on Christmas Eve and New Yearrsquos Eve at pmThose interested in working with Aldi this Christmas should contact Neighbourly at aldichristmas@neighbourly before th December .Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. title: aldi offering courses help babies sleep
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityAldirsquos baby and toddler brand, Mamia, will start making infant sleeping courses affordable for all UK families.Part of its Specialbuy range, in partnership with Just Chill Baby Sleep, Aldi will help to establish healthy sleep routines for parents and their children.Online courses will start from as little as pound. This is a % discount on standard rates across all sleep courses.Parents can choose from four informative courses that cater for new-borns to four-year-olds:Foundations of Sleep: - months.Practical advice on how to navigate the first few months with a new baby, helping to lay solid sleep foundations and understand their sleep habits: pound. .Sleep Success: - months.Help with nap and bedtime challenge and understanding your babyrsquos sleep needs to help them sleep peacefully and achieve a better sleep quality: pound .Sleep Success: - months.Advice on how to successfully navigate nap times, bedtime and approach nighttime wakingrsquos for a better quality sleep: pound .Sleep Success:  months to  years.Understand a childrsquos sleep needs, including when and how to successfully transition them from a cot to a bed, allowing them to sleep happily in their own space: pound .Rosey Davidson, Infant Sleep Consultant and Founder of Just Chill Baby Sleep, says: ldquoIrsquom so excited that Just Chill Baby Sleep is partnering with Aldirsquos baby and toddler brand, Mamia."For so many parents the cost of in-person sleep support is out of reach, which is why we created our online courses and why this partnership means so much."To be able to offer our courses at a massive % discount and reach even more parents in need is fantastic, and wersquore looking forward to helping new parents and their little ones get the best night sleep possible..remove" alt"Penarth Times: Aldi is offering courses on how to get your baby to sleep for under pound " class"editor-image"Aldi is offering courses on how to get your baby to sleep for under pound Here to offer some advice, Rosey has put together a parental checklist for bedtime which she has shared exclusively with Mamia, to give parents a helping hand at what can be the most dficult time of the day:Have a regular, predictable routineHaving a good balance of sleep in the day can really help your baby to sleep well at night. While all babies are dferent, it can be helpful to think about working towards a routine by doing the same things in the same order each night so that baby learns what is coming next.Think about your little onersquos sleep environmentIt can be helpful to black out bedrooms, something that can be especially important in the summer months. Temperature is also important the Lullaby Trust, the baby sleep charity, say that the safest temperature for our little ones is - degrees celsius.Looking at how your little one falls asleep can help them get a more settled nightIt is very normal for your little one to be fed, rocked or cuddled to sleep, however this can be dficult to maintain. Practice other ways of getting your baby to sleep in their own sleep space to help find a method that suits you, your baby and your parenting style.Watch out for signs of tirednessWhile there are typical s of time that babies will happily stay awake for, the most important thing is getting to know your baby. By observing your baby, you can try to get them down for naps during the day before they get overtired. It is also important not to try to force naps when they are under tired.Fresh air and exerciseGetting out of the house for a bit will blow the cobwebs away and help your little one to burn off some energy. Inside the home your little one will also benefit from lots of time on the floor to keep them moving, while for small babies practising a bit of tummy time can be really helpful.Donrsquot always rush inhellipSometimes your little one will babble or make noise while they are asleep, and by going in too quickly we can disturb them. Equally they can sometimes wake and be happy in their sleep space. If your little one doesnrsquot need your assistance it is important to give them the space to get themselves back to sleep independently.Take care of yourself and donrsquot be afraid to ask for helpTherersquos no shame in not being able to do it all, all of the time. Being sleep deprived can be incredibly challenging and feel very lonely. Please know that is very normal for sleep to be dficult, especially in those early days. Please remember being a parent doesnrsquot always feel easy, because itrsquos not! You are doing a great job.To book a course or find out more, visit the Aldi website.Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. Suddenly, a mystery hand appearsand takes away the mince pie, leaving poor Ebanana behind.Watch the Aldi Christmas advert teaser hereAs the banana watches the mince pie being taken it cries, ldquoSanta, waithellip why didnrsquot he take me Quickly Ebananarsquos confusion turns into anger, jumping up and yelling, ldquoI hate ChristmashellipThe clip fades, and the teaser leaves viewers on tenterhooks as to what will happen next in this festive tale.The full Aldi advert will premier online and on national TV on Thursday, November , so we still have some time before we find out how this story ends.Where is Kevin the Carrot Sorry everyone. title: celebrity  previous winners itv show now
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityITV has announced the new serieshosted by Ant and Dec willon Sunday, November .Confirmed: Im A Celebrity...Get Me Out Of Here! starts Sunday  November at pm on ITV.@itv @antanddec @imacelebrity #ImACeleb pic zpleOJBBHRmdash ITV Press CentreNovember , This yearrsquos show will once again be filmed from the historic Gwrych Castle, Abergele in North Wales.Winning the show can often lead to greater fame with lucrative deals and business deals up for grabs for the lucky winner making every dreaded Bushtucker Trial worth it.However, le is not always plain sailing for Jungle castle royalty after ing to normality.Here we take a look at every previous winner of the hit ITV show and find out what theyrsquore up to now.Tony Blackburn -" alt"Penarth Times: Tony Blackburn was the first Im A Celebrity winner. " class"editor-image"Tony Blackburn was the first Im A Celebrity winner. The show made its debut in  with a host of famous celebs including Tara Palmer-Tomkinson, Uri Geller and Christine Hamilton.It was -year-old radio DJ Tony Blackburn who captured the hearts of the nation and was crowned King of the jungle.After leaving the show he continued to have an impressive broadcasting career with the BBC until a brief hiatus in  before ing to be a regular on BBC Radio Two.He is now retired at the age of .Phil Tufnell - " alt"Penarth Times: Former England cricketer Phil Tufnell won the show in . " class"editor-image"Former England cricketer Phil Tufnell won the show in . Former England cricketer Phil Tufnell announced his retirement from the sport shortly before being named as a contestant on the second series of Irsquom A Celeb.His quick wit made him a hit with viewers and the second winner on the show has gone on to become a TV regular.He became a team captain on They Think Itrsquos all over in  before landing his most popular role as team captain on BBCrsquos A Question Of Sport.Phil made it to week nine on the  series of Strictly Come Dancing and appeared on Channel s The Jump..removeHe can still be seen in the small screen today, most recently his golf Netflix show, This Could Go Anywhere.Kerry Katona - " alt"Penarth Times: Kerry Katona became the first Queen of the jungle in . " class"editor-image"Kerry Katona became the first Queen of the jungle in . Kerry Katona became the first Queen of the jungle in  after winning the first of two series that year.Since leaving the jungle Kerry has been in the headlines for a number of reason. She has had a string of relationships in the public eye, including the public break up former husband Brian McFadden.She was inundated with TV offers as she became the face of Iceland and starred in her own reality TV show. She has also appeared on Celebrity Big Brother and Dancing on Ice.Away from our screens the former Atomic Kitten star has recovered from bankruptcy twice, battled drug and alcohol problems and been diagnosed with bipolar disorder.She now creates content for online  OnlyFans among other things.Joe Pasquale - Irsquom A Celeb ed for a second series in .Comedian Joe Pasquale beat off fierce competition from a host of famous faces including former royal butler Paul Burrell, Janet Street Porter and Vic Reeves.After leaving he continued a string of comedy tours and appeared on the  season of Dancing in Ice ing a year later for the showrsquos all-stars season.He still makes the occasional TV appearance, most recently The Nightly Show in .Carol Thatcher - The daughter of former Prime Minister Margaret Thatcher, Carol was a journalist and author before heading to the jungle.She won over viewers with her no-nonsense approach to Bushtucker Trialrsquos.She went on to become a regular on The One Show before being dropped by the BBC after referring to a Tennis player as a ldquogolliwog in an off-camera discussion with Adrian Chiles and Jo Brand.She wrote a book about growing up as the PMrsquos daughter and her motherrsquos battle with dementia.Matt Willis - " alt"Penarth Times: Matt Willis and his we, tv presenter Emma Willis. " class"editor-image"Matt Willis and his we, tv presenter Emma Willis. Busted musician Matt Willis appeared in the  intsalment of the show alongside famous faces including Myleene Klass, Jason Donovan and Dean Gaffney.Hehad already found solo success after leaving Busted before joining the show but turned his attention to TV after winning the crown.Matt hosted the Irsquom A Celeb spin-off show Irsquom A Celebrity: Extra Camp alongside then girlfriend Emma Grfiths for the  series.He has enjoyed a number of acting roles including in the revival of Birds of a Feather and a brief spell on Eastenders, playing the role of Luke Riley.He has since appeared on stage, including roles in Wicked and Footloose.He now has three children with girlfriend Emma, Isabelle, , Ace, eight, and Trixie, four.Christopher Biggins - " alt"Penarth Times: Christopher Biggins beat off competition from Gemma Atkinson and Janice Dickinson. " class"editor-image"Christopher Biggins beat off competition from Gemma Atkinson and Janice Dickinson. The veteran actor was already a household name famous for roles in shows such as Upstairs, Downstairs and Porridge.He beat off competition from Gemma Atkinson and Janice Dickinson to claim the title of King of the jungle.He went on to appear in a number of celebrity shows including Come Dine With Me and Masterchef.In  he was booted off Celebrity Big Brother after a number of ldquooffensive outbursts that werenrsquot shown on TV.Joe Swash - " alt"Penarth Times: Joe Swash made it to the final of this yearrsquos Celebrity MasterChef. " class"editor-image"Joe Swash made it to the final of this yearrsquos Celebrity MasterChef. The former Eastenders star won the eighthseries of the show in .Since leaving the show Swash hosted Extra Camp for nearly a decade alongside stars such as Caroline Flack and his now fiance Stacey Solomon.More recently he has appeared on Celebrity Gogglebox and won Dancing on Ice at the start of , before making it to the final of this yearrsquos Celebrity MasterChef.He welcomed his second child, Rose Opal Esme Solomon-Swash, with Stacey Solomon after welcoming their son, Rex, in .The pair got engaged last Christmas but delayed their wedding after she announced her pregnancy in June.Gino DrsquoAcampo - " alt"Penarth Times: Gino is now regular on This Morning and Celebrity Juice. " class"editor-image"Gino is now regular on This Morning and Celebrity Juice. Celebrity chef Gino won the  series despite controversy.After leaving the jungle both he and co-star Stuart Manning faced animal cruelty charges for killing and cooking a rat during the show.The charges were later dropped when ITV took responsibility and paid a pound, fine.Gino is now regular on This Morning and Celebrity Juice. He also presents ITVs Family Fortunes.He can also be seen travelling the world with fellow chef Gordon Ramsay and First dates restaurant manager Fred Serieix in Gordon, Gino and Fred.Stacey Solomon - " alt"Penarth Times: Stacey Solomon is a regular on ITVs Loose Women. " class"editor-image"Stacey Solomon is a regular on ITVs Loose Women. Stacey Solomon rose to fame after finishing runner-up to Joe McElderry and Olly Murs on The X Factor.She released her debut album, Shy, in  and has been a regular list on Loose Women since .She took over from Laura Whitmore as presenter of Irsquom A Celeb Extra Camp before being dropped in .It was here her romance with no fianceacute and fellow Irsquom A Celeb winner Joe Swash begun.They are now engaged to be married and welcomed their second child earlier this year.Dougie Poynter ndash " alt"Penarth Times: McFlys Dougie Pointer won the show in . " class"editor-image"McFlys Dougie Pointer won the show in . McFlyrsquos Dougie Poynter won the show while taking a break from the band in .McFly have recently released new music and took part in numerous tours around the UK ndash they also teamed up with Busted to create the supergroup McBusted.He has also seen success as a model for brands including Dolce  Gabbana.Charlie Brooks ndash " alt"Penarth Times: Charlie Brooks has recently ed to Eastenders. " class"editor-image"Charlie Brooks has recently ed to Eastenders. The  winner is best known for her role as Janine Butcher in BBC soap Eastenders.Following her win, she continued with her role until .Since then, she has appeared in a number of TV shows and has seen success with fitness DVDs following her own weight loss.Charlie has recently ed to Albert Square to reprise her role as Janine Butcher in Eastenders.Kian Egan ndash Westle star Kian joined the show after his band split and the girlband he managed, Wonderland, failed.He released his debut solo album after winning the show and reached number  in the UK charts.Since then he has gone on to be a coach on The Voice of Ireland.Im A Celebrity...Get Me Out Of Here! quiz Test your knowldge here:Carl Fogarty ndash Carl ldquoFoggy Fogarty was a superbike champion before winning the th series after forming a hilarious friendship with former Premier League footballer Jimmy Bullard.He won the show after eating bull penis and ostrich anus during the live final.Following the show he set up fellow contestant Jake Quickenden with his own daughter, Danielle.The couple are no longer together.Vicky Pattison" alt"Penarth Times: Vicky Pattison joined the show after quitting MTV hit Geordie Shore.. " class"editor-image"Vicky Pattison joined the show after quitting MTV hit Geordie Shore.. Vicky Pattison joined the show after quitting MTV hit Geordie Shore.Since leaving as queen of the jungle she became a celebrity fitness influencer and presented Extra Camp for one year after being crowned winner.She also appeared in the Australian version of the show.She regularly updates fans on Instagram and can be seen on TV shows, most recently Celebrity SAS: Who Dares Wins.Scarlett Moffatt ndash " alt"Penarth Times: Scarlett rose to fame after appearing with her family on Channel rsquos hit show Gogglebox. " class"editor-image"Scarlett rose to fame after appearing with her family on Channel rsquos hit show Gogglebox. Scarlett rose to fame after appearing with her family on Channel rsquos hit show Gogglebox and proved a hit with ITV viewers after being crowned queen of the jungle.He appearance on the show impressed host Ant and Dec s much that she was invited to co-host Ant  Decrsquos Saturday Night Takeaway. She also co hosted spin-off show Extra Camp during the following season.Georgia lsquoToffrsquo Toffolo ndash " alt"Penarth Times: lsquoToffrsquo rose to fame after appearing in Ersquos reality series Made in Cha. " class"editor-image"lsquoToffrsquo rose to fame after appearing in Ersquos reality series Made in Cha. lsquoToffrsquo rose to fame after appearing in Ersquos reality series Made in Cha.Despite her posh background her friendship with Stanley Johnson and her down to earth personality won the hearts of ITV viewers.Since leaving the jungle she can regularly be seen presenting on ITVrsquos This Morning and has popped up in Celebrity Gogglebox alongside her friend Stan, who just happens to be the Prime Ministerrsquos dad.Harry Redknapp ndash " alt"Penarth Times: Harry Redknapp had ITV viewers in stitches on Im A Celeb. " class"editor-image"Harry Redknapp had ITV viewers in stitches on Im A Celeb. Harry Redknapp already had a strong following from his football career, particularly as a manager but gained a whole new following after winning the show in .Having never watched the show, Harry had viewers in stitches and his undying love for his we, Sandra, made him a hit with viewers.He has since gone on to star in numerous TV shows and recently sold his Sandbanks home to build his wersquos dream home nearby.Jacqueline Jossa ndash " alt"Penarth Times: Jacqueline Jossa. " class"editor-image"Jacqueline Jossa. Jacqueline rose to fame portraying Lauren Branning in BBC soap Eastenders.She received backing from viewers after campmate Myles Stephenson apparently told the actress her husband Dan Osbourne had romantic fling with his ex, Gabby Allen.She became the first winner to cancel all interviews when the show came to an end and enjoyed time with her family.She has since built a huge following on social media and has launched a range of clothing lines.Giovanna Fletcher ndash " alt"Penarth Times: Giovanna Fletcher won over her fellow campmates and the public. " class"editor-image"Giovanna Fletcher won over her fellow campmates and the public. title: road repairs branded diabolical
story: Mike Nesbitt joins calls for apology over MLA’s ‘sectarian’ RUC comments   Man and woman arrested after woman seriously injured in CraigavonNewsTraffic and TravelCrimeWeatherPoliticsBusinessEducationHealthPeopleRead ThisCoronavirusSportFootballOther SportWhats OnArts and EntertainmentThings To DoHomes and GardensLestyleCarsHomes and GardensPublic NoticesAdvertise My BusinessFree Happy AdsNewsPoliticsRoad repairs branded ‘diabolical’A Portadown councillor has hit out at the condition in which a road was left following recent utility work in the area.By The NewsroomThursday, th November , : am  "       "  The work in question involved the laying of pipes for Firmus Energy on the Armagh Road, Portadown. While acknowledging the work led to delays for motorists, Councillor Lavelle McIlwrath said they were viewed as a necessaryevil in order to deliver services to the area.However, he criticisedthe condition of the repair work between the traffic lights at Mahon junction an Ridgeway Park, describing it as “diabolical”.“I have had numerous complaints from motorists about the way the Armagh Road has been left.“The section of roadway that was dug up cannot now be avoided as you drive towards town and the uneven way the repaired carriageway has been left is shocking.“The irony is that this stretch of roadway was one of the better ones in the area prior to the roadworks and is now one of the worst.”Cllr McIlwrath confirmed he had raisedthe matter with both Firmus Energy and the Department for Infrastructure and said they energy firm has agreed tothe road to its original standard.“I raisedthe matter directly with Firmus Energy as well as the Department for Infrastructure,” he said.“I am pleased to confirm that Firmus Energy has agreed to revisittheir repairs at the Armagh Road and ensure that this stretch of carriageway is ed to its original standard.“The work will take several weeks to plan and coordinate.”Speaking to the Local Democracy Reporting Service, a spokesperson for Firmus Energy confirmed the road surface will be repaired.“We have been liaising with Councillor McIlwrath, the Department for Infrastructure and our contractors to agree a plan to repair the road surface and hope to have that work completed as soon as possible.”Editor’s message:Thank you for reading this article. We’re more reliant on your support than ever as the sht in consumer habits brought about by Coronavirus impacts our advertisers.Please consider purchasing a copy of the paper. title: mike nesbitt joins calls for apology over mlas sectarian ruc comments
story: Halloween hooligans’ rampage in Lurgan ‘terried’ residents   Road repairs branded ‘diabolical’NewsTraffic and TravelCrimeWeatherPoliticsBusinessEducationHealthPeopleRead ThisCoronavirusSportFootballOther SportWhats OnArts and EntertainmentThings To DoHomes and GardensLestyleCarsHomes and GardensPublic NoticesAdvertise My BusinessFree Happy AdsNewsPoliticsMike Nesbitt joins calls for apology over MLA’s ‘sectarian’ RUC commentsA row over an MLA’s claim the RUC represented “institutionalised sectarianism” has escalated with Mike Nesbitt joining calls for Dolores Kelly to apologise.By Mark RaineyFriday, th November , : pm  "       "  RUC officer at the scene of a terrorist atrocity in Belfast city centre in . Photo: PacemakerUpper Bann MLA Mrs Kelly was quoted in a newspaper article as saying this week’s PSNI th anniversary was the perfect opportunity to recommit to the principle of a shared police force. The SDLP policing board member also said the creation of the PSNI was a “signicant departure from the institutionalised sectarianism represented by the RUC”.Those comments led to the NI Retired Police Officers’ Association penning an open letter to Mrs Kelly, in which the NIRPOA chairman called on the MLA to withdraw her remarks, and to apologise for the “gross offence” caused.The letter states: “I am writing to seek your immediate withdrawal of that remark, and an apology for the gross offence you have caused to the thousands of members of the Royal Ulster Constabulary GC who served this community in the most challenging of times.”Mrs Kelly responded, saying: “The SDLP has previously paid tribute to the sacrices made by many RUC officers and their families.“The fact remains that there were severe institutional problems within the RUC and this is a matter of public record. That many retired police officers continue to refuse to cooperate with legacy investigations to this day speaks for itself.”Mrs Kelly added: “The transformation of the RUC to the PSNI has been an outstanding success and whilst policing continues to be challenging I think the hard work and efforts of the those involved in implementing Patten’s recommendations deserve credit.”Ulster Unionist policing board member Mr Nesbitt said he believes his SDLP counterpart should “reflect on her comments and the hurt they have caused and apologise”.He said: “The RUC were the barrier between Northern Ireland and complete anarchy. They bravely held the line throughout the Troubles.“Dolores Kelly’s comments have caused great hurt to former officers, their families and friends. Police officers didn’t wake up hoping to hurt someone, but every terrorist did, and it was police officers who were targeted simply because they were trying to protect society and save lives”.Mr Nesbitt added: “Nobody disputes that the RUC could have done with more Catholic officers within its ranks.“I have no doubt that many more would have come forward had it not been for the fact that the IRA made a special effort to target those Catholics who did join the RUC”.Mike NesbittPSNI  "       "  Most PopularMike Nesbitt joins calls for apology over MLA’s ‘sectarian’ RUC commentsRoad repairs branded ‘diabolical’Portadown: Four people taken to hospital after two vehicle crashHalloween hooligans’ rampage in Lurgan ‘terried’ residentsTotal of  years for heroin gangMost PopularTotal of  years for heroin gang‘What school grades do I need to join PSNI – and how much will I earn ’Stephen Barriskill killing: PSNI charge -year-old man with murderPSNI’s Organised Crime Branch searched JMC Mechanical and Construction Ltd premises days before firm collapsed‘Viable device’ found by bomb experts during Craigavon security alert                       This website and its associated newspaper are members of Independent Press Standards Organisation Follow us on    ExploreNewsSportWhats OnLestyleMore from Portadown TimesAnnouncementsJobsPublic NoticesMust ReadBuy a PhotoDirectoryUseful LinksContact UsAdvertise My BusinessAdvertise a JobPlace your AdSubscribeEventsArchiveReaders Charter " fill"#ea"  ©JPIMedia Publishing Ltd. ." target"_self" href"#" id"cookieSettings" class"sc-dqBHgY sc-gxMtzJ bAegnq"Cookie SettingsTerms and ConditionsPrivacy policyModern Slavery Statement  News you can trust since News" class"expand" role"button" tabindex""  " "  "  scale translate " points"  .  . title: top tips for safe student accommodation
story: With freshers week around the corner and thousands of young people in Northern Ireland set to start University or new career paths, many will be on the hunt for rented accommodation. Northern Ireland has experienced a .% increase in average rental values this year[]. With the price increase, OFTEC, representing the liquid fuel industry in Ireland, is concerned that students may take cheaper accommodation options without properly inspecting the property. With this in mind, OFTEC has issued advise to help students ensure their accommodation is safe before they sign the dotted line. Raise the alarm – Currently, it is not a mandatory requirement for private landlords to provide smoke and carbon monoxide detectors, but the HSENI recommend that they do. It is a legal requirement to fit a carbon monoxide detector when a fossil fuel appliance has been replaced. Carbon monoxide is potentially lethal as it has no smell, taste or colour. Without a working alarm, it is impossible to identy carbon monoxide leaks. OFTEC’s advise is to ensure that there are working fire and CO alarms in the property, and that they are tested on a regular basis.Heating requirements - The Health  Safety Executive recommend that all boilers should be serviced annually and tenants should ask for evidence of recent servicing. If you have concerns, ask for a CD  Landlord Oil Installation Check which is carried out by an OFTEC registered technician and will give you peace of mind. For a gas heated property, ask for a copy of the annual gas safety check.Look for damp – It is easy to hide damp patches with a coat of paint, soyour house smells musty or you see evidence of mould, find out how the landlord is planning to fix the problem. Mould has no place in the home as it can cause respiratory problems and headaches.Furniture and fittings – Ask the landlord for a list of everything that is included and make note of any damage that is there before you move it. Check any beds, sofas and chairs are in good condition.Secure your home – burglars may target student areas because of lax security. Ask your landlord to fit key operating locks on the windows and lever deadlocks on external doors.  OFTEC Ireland Manager, David Blevings, said: “Quite often the excitement of moving in with friends can overshadow the concerns about the accommodation itself. We are urging students to play it safe this year and carry out these essential checks before signing a lease and moving in. “Asking a landlord about safety may seem awkward, but it could prevent you from living in a potentially dangerous property for the next  months. It’s vital that your new home is not a burden as you start your time at university. To find your nearest registered technician visit www.oftec.org  addthis,     Leave your commentTyrone Constitution- High Street, OmaghBT BDTel:     , ,, , ,  .jsp, , ,   , ,success:  ,  n n nHome n n
